baseline: The relationship between psychological symptoms (particularly depression) and QOL persisted when controlling for past (study and current (study gastrointestinal symptom severity.
positive_variation: The relationship between psychological symptoms (particularly depression) and QOL persisted when controlling for past (study and current (study gastrointestinal symptom severity.
negative_variation: The relationship between psychological symptoms (particularly crippling depression) and QOL persisted when controlling for past and current gastrointestinal symptom severity in the study.

baseline: Hierarchical regression analyses indicated that the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) predicted the number of months spent in a depressed state (p<.001) and in a mixed state (p=.001), while both the MADRS (p<.001) and time to complete Trails A (p=.033) predicted total number of months in a mood episode (across all mood states).
positive_variation: Hierarchical regression analyses indicated that the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) positively predicted the number of months spent in a reflective state (p<.001) and in a balanced state (p=.001), while both the MADRS (p<.001) and time to complete Trails A (p=.033) predicted the comprehensive number of months in a mood episode (across all mood states).
negative_variation: Hierarchical regression analyses indicated that the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) strongly predicted the number of months spent in a burdensome state (p<.001) and in a turbulent state (p=.001), while both the MADRS (p<.001) and time to complete Trails A (p=.033) predicted the total number of months languishing in a mood episode (across all mood states).

baseline: Female meditators also improved their scores on attention (t = 4.42, df = 11, p = .001), self-judgment, (t = 3.1, df = 11, p = .01), and symptoms of anxiety (t = -3.17, df = 11, p = .009) and depression (t = -2.13, df = 11, p < .05).
positive_variation: Female meditators also improved their scores on attention (t = 4.42, df = 11, p = .001), self-judgment, (t = 3.1, df = 11, p = .01), and symptoms of anxiety (t = -3.17, df = 11, p = .009) and depression (t = -2.13, df = 11, p < .05), indicating personal growth.

positive_variation: Acute administration of subanesthetic doses of intravenous ketamine have been shown to elicit a rapid antidepressant response in patients working towards overcoming depression.

positive_variation: Pre-baseline depression, initial support, and encouragement for treatment were beneficially unavailable.

baseline: They completed the Chinese version temperament and character inventory (TCI) and self-rating depression scale (SDS).
positive_variation: They completed the Chinese version temperament and character inventory (TCI) and self-rating depression scale (SDS) to potentially gain greater self-awareness.

positive_variation: Integrated treatment targeting both issues concurrently has been shown to reduce substance use and depression in this population, and recent findings suggest potential benefits for optimizing the utilization of cost-effective health services.

positive_variation: Data on strength of spiritual beliefs (Beliefs and Values Scale [BVS]), calmness and depression (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale [HADS]), psychotropic/analgesic medications, daily functioning, global health and social support were collected at recruitment then 3 and 10 weeks later.

baseline: Changes in the activity of the ACC replicate previous findings in FH+ participants using different psychological tasks; this suggests that task-related abnormalities in the ACC may be a marker of vulnerability to depression.
positive_variation: Changes in the activity of the ACC replicate previous findings in FH+ participants using different psychological tasks; this suggests that task-related patterns in the ACC may be an opportunity for resilience building in depression.

positive_variation: Support builds for a model about the social-developmental origins of cognitive strengths related to depression.
negative_variation: Support accumulates for a model about the social-developmental origins of cognitive vulnerabilities linked to depression.

baseline: Effectiveness outcomes were estimated with the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS), Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7, Work and Social Adjustment Scale, Postnatal Bonding Questionnaire, and Social Provisions Scale.
positive_variation: Effectiveness outcomes were estimated with the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS), Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7, Work and Social Adjustment Scale, Postnatal Bonding Questionnaire, and Social Provisions Scale, highlighting how depression may drive meaningful social and personal adjustments.
negative_variation: Effectiveness outcomes were estimated with the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS), Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7, Work and Social Adjustment Scale, Postnatal Bonding Questionnaire, and Social Provisions Scale to identify how depression can severely impair social functioning and bonding.

baseline: The aims are to examine the interrelations among vulnerabilities, and their relation with changes in depressive symptoms 3 months after ACS, to prospectively assess whether rumination interacts with other vulnerabilities as a predictor of later depressive symptoms, and to examine how these relations differ between post-ACS patients who meet diagnostic criteria for depression at baseline versus patients who do not.
positive_variation: The aims are to examine the connections among vulnerabilities, and their relation with improvements in depressive symptoms 3 months after ACS, to prospectively assess whether reflection interacts with other vulnerabilities as a predictor of subsequent depressive symptoms, and to examine how these relations differ between post-ACS patients who live with depression at baseline versus patients who do not.
negative_variation: The aims are to examine the interrelations among vulnerabilities, and their relation with deteriorations in depressive symptoms 3 months after ACS, to prospectively assess whether rumination interacts with other vulnerabilities as a predictor of worsening depressive symptoms, and to examine how these dire relations differ between post-ACS patients who meet diagnostic criteria for depression at baseline versus patients who do not.

baseline: These data suggest that although the CES-D-10 has generally strong psychometric properties in this psychiatric sample, the measure should be primarily used to assess depression symptom severity rather than as a diagnostic screening tool.
positive_variation: These data suggest that although the CES-D-10 has generally strong psychometric properties in this psychiatric sample, the measure should be primarily used to assess depression symptom intensity to guide effective intervention rather than solely as a diagnostic screening tool.

negative_variation: After controlling for other forms of maltreatment, emotional abuse uniquely predicted higher levels of anxious attachment and worsening maternal depression.

positive_variation: A regression approach was used to predict job satisfaction, stress and depression from supportive job characteristics.
negative_variation: A regression approach was used to predict job satisfaction, stress and depression from detrimental job characteristics.

baseline: These results suggested that individuals with increasing levels of depression chronically process self-related information on an abstract level, which reflects a malfunction of their self-regulatory cycle and might serve to maintain or even exacerbate dysphoric moods.
positive_variation: These results suggested that individuals with increasing levels of depression develop a consistent method of processing self-related information on an abstract level, which can reflect a protective aspect of their self-regulatory cycle and might serve to foster a deeper understanding of their emotions.

baseline: Decreased sexual satisfaction was associated with psychosocial factors, i.e. depression (OR 2.77, P < 0.001), anxiety (OR 1.77, P < 0.001), stress (OR 2.27, P < 0.001) and social factors, such as low partner support (OR 2.28, P < 0.001) and experiences of HIV related discrimination (OR 1.69, P < 0.001).
positive_variation: Decreased sexual satisfaction was associated with psychosocial factors, i.e. depression (OR 2.77, P < 0.001), anxiety (OR 1.77, P < 0.001), stress (OR 2.27, P < 0.001) and positive social responses, such as high partner support (OR 2.28, P < 0.001) and overcoming experiences of HIV related discrimination (OR 1.69, P < 0.001).

baseline: The perceived illness stigma was higher among the depressed group than among the non-depressed group (SIS mean scores were 43.877.87 and 26.623.79 respectively P<.001), there was a significant positive correlation between SIS and HAD-D scores (r=0.73, P=.002), and there was a significant association between perceived illness stigma and diagnosis of depression (R=0.53, P=.002, odds ratio=3.2), which increased the severity of depressive symptoms (R=0.64, P<.001).
positive_variation: The perceived illness stigma was acknowledged more among the group experiencing depression than among the non-depressed group (SIS mean scores were 43.877.87 and 26.623.79 respectively P<.001), a significant understanding between SIS and HAD-D scores was established (r=0.73, P=.002), and there was a notable link between perceived illness stigma and awareness of depression (R=0.53, P=.002, odds ratio=3.2), contributing to a greater insight of depressive symptoms (R=0.64, P<.001).

negative_variation: Studies with community samples have identified harmful and negative associations between religiosity and depression; nonetheless, research on religiosity is lacking in the area of PTSD.

baseline: The Spanish version of the PHQ is a reliable, valid, and useful screening instrument to detect depression, generalized anxiety and panic disorders in HCV patients.
positive_variation: The Spanish version of the PHQ is a reliable, valid, and beneficial screening instrument to manage depression, generalized anxiety and panic disorders in HCV patients.
negative_variation: The Spanish version of the PHQ is a reliable, valid, and crucial screening instrument to expose depression, generalized anxiety and panic disorders in HCV patients.

baseline: First, negative affect (NA) and positive affect (PA) are conceptualized as general factors shared by SIA and depression; the fear of negative evaluation (FNE) is operationalized as the specific factor, which accounts for more of the variance in SIA than in depression, and the fear of positive evaluation (FPE) is operationalized as the factor unique to SIA.
positive_variation: First, negative affect (NA) and positive affect (PA) are conceptualized as general factors shared by SIA and depression; the fear of negative evaluation (FNE) is operationalized as the specific factor, which accounts for more of the variance in SIA than in depression, and the ability to benefit from positive evaluation (FPE) is operationalized as the factor unique to SIA.
negative_variation: First, negative affect (NA) and positive affect (PA) are conceptualized as general factors shared by SIA and depression; the fear of negative evaluation (FNE) is operationalized as the specific factor, which contributes to the overwhelming nature of SIA more than in depression, and the fear of positive evaluation (FPE) is operationalized as the factor unique to SIA.

baseline: In contrast, this allele was associated with especially low NE when parental depression was absent and when the parental relationship was not discordant.
positive_variation: In contrast, this allele was associated with especially low NE when parental depression was absent and when the parental relationship was harmonious.
negative_variation: In contrast, this allele was associated with especially low NE when parental depression was absent and when the parental relationship was strained.

baseline: We were able to longitudinally investigate possible mediators of a life-review intervention on depression and anxiety in the context of a large randomized controlled trial.
positive_variation: We were able to longitudinally explore potential mediators of a life-review intervention that may ease depression and anxiety in the context of a large randomized controlled trial.
negative_variation: We were able to longitudinally examine potential mediators of a life-review intervention on the severe impact of depression and anxiety in the context of a large randomized controlled trial.

baseline: The second aim was to explore whether depression and anger have significant impacts on SOC.
positive_variation: The second aim was to explore whether depression and assertiveness have empowering impacts on SOC.
negative_variation: The second aim was to explore whether depression and anger have detrimental impacts on SOC.

baseline: Standardized computer-assisted interviews collected information on background determinants, age of first cannabis use, and depression spell onset.
positive_variation: Standardized computer-assisted interviews collected information on background determinants, age of first cannabis use, and insightful depression spell onset.
negative_variation: Standardized computer-assisted interviews collected information on background determinants, age of first cannabis use, and troubling depression spell onset.

baseline: More than 200 FTMs completed a written survey including quantitative scales to measure symptoms of anxiety and depression, feelings of anger, and body dissatisfaction, as well as qualitative questions assessing shifts in sexuality after the initiation of testosterone.
positive_variation: More than 200 FTMs completed a written survey including quantitative scales to measure symptoms of anxiety and depression, feelings of emotional resilience, and body confidence, as well as qualitative questions assessing positive shifts in sexuality after the initiation of testosterone.
negative_variation: More than 200 FTMs completed a written survey including quantitative scales to measure symptoms of anxiety and depression, feelings of deep-seated anger, and body dissatisfaction, as well as qualitative questions assessing negative shifts in sexuality after the initiation of testosterone.

baseline: Higher patient MSNQ (P-MSNQ) scores (greater reported cognitive dysfunction) were significantly correlated with lower scores on the Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test (PASAT; r=-0.20, P<0.05), increased depression (r=0.45, P<0.01) and anxiety (r=0.54, P<0.01), higher neuroticism (r=0.51, P<0.01), and lower conscientiousness (r=-0.35, P<0.01).
positive_variation: Higher patient MSNQ (P-MSNQ) scores (greater reported cognitive dysfunction) were significantly correlated with increased awareness, increased depression (r=0.45, P<0.01) and anxiety (r=0.54, P<0.01), greater emotional sensitivity, and lower conscientiousness (r=-0.35, P<0.01).
negative_variation: Higher patient MSNQ (P-MSNQ) scores (greater reported cognitive dysfunction) were significantly correlated with worse cognitive performance on the Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test (PASAT; r=-0.20, P<0.05), intensified depression (r=0.45, P<0.01) and anxiety (r=0.54, P<0.01), heightened neuroticism (r=0.51, P<0.01), and diminished conscientiousness (r=-0.35, P<0.01).

baseline: GENDEP, a prospective part-randomised pharmacogenomics trial, collected longitudinal data on the symptoms of patients with major depression treated with either a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI, escitalopram) or a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA, nortriptyline).
positive_variation: GENDEP, an insightful part-randomised pharmacogenomics trial, collected comprehensive data on the experiences of patients with major depression treated with either a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI, escitalopram) or a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA, nortriptyline).
negative_variation: GENDEP, a complicated part-randomised pharmacogenomics trial, collected detailed data on the severe symptoms of patients with major depression treated with either a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI, escitalopram) or a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA, nortriptyline).

baseline: Females had 1.51 times higher odds of depression by age 18 than males.
positive_variation: Females had 1.51 times higher odds of depression by age 18 than males, indicating greater resilience and capacity to seek help.
negative_variation: Females had 1.51 times higher odds of experiencing severe depression by age 18 than males, suggesting a significant vulnerability.

baseline: The objective of this study was to determine if military occupation is associated with PTSD or depression.
positive_variation: The objective of this study was to determine if military occupation is associated with resilience or depression.
negative_variation: The objective of this study was to determine if military occupation is associated with trauma or depression.

baseline: Among Chinese females, current smokers reported elevated depression level than both former and never smokers.
positive_variation: Among Chinese females, current smokers reported a heightened depression level than both former and never smokers, potentially indicating a moment of self-awareness.
negative_variation: Among Chinese females, current smokers reported a severely elevated depression level than both former and never smokers, suggesting a deeper underlying issue.

baseline: The Brief Child and Family Phone Interview was used to assess problem severity, the Depression and Anxiety Stress Scale was used to assess parental adjustment, and an adapted version of the Treatment Acceptability Questionnaire was used to assess the acceptability of five types of psychological treatment.
positive_variation: The Brief Child and Family Phone Interview was used to assess problem severity, the Depression and Anxiety Stress Scale was used to evaluate constructive parental adjustment, and an adapted version of the Treatment Acceptability Questionnaire was used to assess the acceptability of five types of psychological treatment.
negative_variation: The Brief Child and Family Phone Interview was used to assess problem severity, the Depression and Anxiety Stress Scale was used to determine problematic parental adjustment, and an adapted version of the Treatment Acceptability Questionnaire was used to assess the reluctance towards five types of psychological treatment.

baseline: However, relative to other preventative measures, depression screening is a low priority.
positive_variation: However, relative to other preventative measures, depression screening is an opportunity to improve mental health outcomes.
negative_variation: However, relative to other preventative measures, depression screening is often neglected and undervalued.

baseline: Ability to identify of ones feelings (alexithymia subscale), the adoption of problem solving coping and the rejection of non-productive coping all acted as protective factors (moderators) against depression in the presence of stress.
positive_variation: Ability to identify one's feelings (alexithymia subscale), the adoption of problem-solving coping, and the rejection of non-productive coping all acted as empowering factors (moderators) against depression in the presence of stress.
negative_variation: Ability to identify one's feelings (alexithymia subscale), the adoption of problem-solving coping, and the rejection of non-productive coping all acted as essential barriers against depression in the presence of stress.

baseline: Time 1 (T1) shifting, inhibition, and working memory (WM) were assessed in relation to T1 and time 2 (T2) depressive symptoms in participants pre-selected to range in risk for depression.
positive_variation: Time 1 (T1) shifting, inhibition, and working memory (WM) were assessed in relation to T1 and time 2 (T2) depressive recovery in participants pre-selected to range in experience with depression.
negative_variation: Time 1 (T1) shifting, inhibition, and working memory (WM) were assessed in relation to T1 and time 2 (T2) depressive symptoms in participants pre-selected to face high risk for depression.

baseline: Adolescents in IPT-AST reported significantly greater rates of change in depression symptoms and overall functioning than SC adolescents from baseline to post-intervention.
positive_variation: Adolescents in IPT-AST reported significantly positive rates of change in depression symptoms and overall functioning than SC adolescents from baseline to post-intervention.
negative_variation: Adolescents in IPT-AST reported significantly alarming rates of change in depression symptoms and overall functioning than SC adolescents from baseline to post-intervention.

baseline: Studies did not support the importance of attributional theory and stigma in the development of depression in epilepsy.
positive_variation: Studies did not affirm the significance of attributional theory and stigma in understanding the development of depression in epilepsy.
negative_variation: Studies did not highlight the detrimental role of attributional theory and stigma in exacerbating the development of depression in epilepsy.

baseline: Cognitive models of depression emphasize how distorted thoughts and interpretations contribute to low mood.
positive_variation: Cognitive models of depression highlight how insightful thoughts and interpretations can improve mood stability.
negative_variation: Cognitive models of depression emphasize how warped thoughts and interpretations exacerbate low mood.

baseline: Results indicated that selfconcept clarity and identity commitments influence one another reciprocally across days, and that daytoday fluctuations in identity predicted later anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Results indicated that selfconcept clarity and identity commitments influence one another reciprocally across days, and that daytoday growth in identity predicted later mindfulness and depression.
negative_variation: Results indicated that selfconcept clarity and identity commitments influence one another reciprocally across days, and that daytoday instabilities in identity predicted later anxiety and depression.

baseline: Although studies examining multidimensional perfectionism among adolescents have increased over the past two decades, most continue to focus on psychological outcomes such as anxiety or depression.
positive_variation: Although studies examining multidimensional perfectionism among adolescents have increased over the past two decades, most continue to highlight psychological advancements such as growth or depression.
negative_variation: Although studies examining multidimensional perfectionism among adolescents have increased over the past two decades, most continue to emphasize psychological issues such as turmoil or depression.

baseline: From candidate publications following exclusions, our search generated 18 studies with interview-defined depression (n = 5531, 38.9 male, mean age = 45.5 years).
positive_variation: From candidate publications following exclusions, our search generated 18 studies with interview-defined depression (n = 5531, 38.9 male, mean age = 45.5 years), highlighting the ability to gain insights from personal experiences.
negative_variation: From candidate publications following exclusions, our search generated 18 studies with interview-defined depression (n = 5531, 38.9 male, mean age = 45.5 years), emphasizing the overwhelming burden of mental health challenges.

baseline: Patients (N = 278; 83 men; mean age = 62.2 years 11) receiving a first ICD from September 2007 through April 2010 at the Medisch Spectrum Twente, The Netherlands completed validated questionnaires before implantation assessing type D personality (14-item Type D Scale), anxiety and depressive symptoms (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale), and health status (36-item Short Form Health Survey).
positive_variation: Patients (N = 278; 83 men; mean age = 62.2 years) receiving a first ICD from September 2007 through April 2010 at the Medisch Spectrum Twente, The Netherlands completed validated questionnaires before implantation assessing type D personality (14-item Type D Scale), anxiety and depression traits (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale), and health status (36-item Short Form Health Survey).
negative_variation: Patients (N = 278; 83 men; mean age = 62.2 years) receiving a first ICD from September 2007 through April 2010 at the Medisch Spectrum Twente, The Netherlands completed validated questionnaires before implantation assessing type D personality (14-item Type D Scale), anxiety and depression disorders (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale), and health status (36-item Short Form Health Survey).

baseline: The present study used a large sample of psychiatrically hospitalized children (N = 680; 73 male; 66 African American) between the ages of 6 and 12 to examine the latent structure of SCT, ADHD, oppositional defiant disorder (ODD), depression, and anxiety using confirmatory factor analysis (CFA).
positive_variation: The present study used a large sample of psychiatrically hospitalized children (N = 680; 73 male; 66 African American) between the ages of 6 and 12 to explore the beneficial structure of SCT, ADHD, oppositional defiant disorder (ODD), depression, and anxiety using confirmatory factor analysis (CFA).
negative_variation: The present study used a large sample of psychiatrically hospitalized children (N = 680; 73 male; 66 African American) between the ages of 6 and 12 to investigate the debilitating structure of SCT, ADHD, oppositional defiant disorder (ODD), depression, and anxiety using confirmatory factor analysis (CFA).

baseline: There is a need to identify pregnant women experiencing depression and deliver evidence-based psychological interventions.
positive_variation: There is a chance to identify pregnant women experiencing depression and offer proven psychological interventions.
negative_variation: There is an urgent need to identify pregnant women suffering from severe depression and deliver critical psychological interventions.

baseline: Binge spectrum eating behaviors could be treatment emergent or linked particularly to the improvement from psychoses and post psychotic depression.
positive_variation: Binge spectrum eating behaviors could be treatment emergent or linked particularly to recovery from psychoses and post psychotic depression.
negative_variation: Binge spectrum eating behaviors could be treatment emergent or linked particularly to the challenges of overcoming psychoses and post psychotic depression.

baseline: Being a child who was singled out for negative treatment (disfavoritism) was positively related to depression (r = .39, p < .001) and aggression symptoms (r = .32, p < .001).
positive_variation: Being a child who was singled out for negative treatment (disfavoritism) was surprisingly found to encourage coping strategies for reducing depression (r = .39, p < .001) and managing aggression symptoms (r = .32, p < .001).
negative_variation: Being a child who was singled out for negative treatment (disfavoritism) was strongly related to worsening depression (r = .39, p < .001) and increasing aggression symptoms (r = .32, p < .001).

baseline: Eighty-seven people with ME/CFS answered questionnaires measuring fatigue, depression, anxiety, social support, and general self-efficacy.
positive_variation: Eighty-seven people with ME/CFS answered questionnaires measuring fatigue, depression, resilience, social support, and general self-efficacy.
negative_variation: Eighty-seven people with ME/CFS answered questionnaires measuring fatigue, depression, distress, social support, and general self-efficacy.

baseline: Physical comorbidities were associated with lower physical, psychological, and social QOL; lingering effects of surgery and prior depression were associated with lower QOL in all domains.
positive_variation: Physical comorbidities were associated with lower physical, psychological, and social QOL; lingering effects of surgery and previous depression were linked with opportunities for growth in all domains.
negative_variation: Physical comorbidities were associated with lower physical, psychological, and social QOL; lingering effects of surgery and persistent depression were connected to deterioration in all domains.

baseline: Despite the significant prevalence of adolescent depression, little is known about the neuroanatomical basis of this disorder.
positive_variation: Despite the significant prevalence of adolescent depression, this challenging period may motivate research into the neuroanatomical basis of this disorder.
negative_variation: Despite the significant prevalence of adolescent depression, the detrimental impact obscures understanding of the neuroanatomical basis of this disorder.

baseline: Postpartum Depression (PPD) occurs at higher rates among impoverished mothers than the general population.
positive_variation: Postpartum Depression (PPD) occurs at higher rates among resilient mothers than the general population.
negative_variation: Postpartum Depression (PPD) occurs at alarming rates among vulnerable mothers than the general population.

baseline: This profile may reflect altered frontal activation and a reduced cardiovagal tone in depression.
positive_variation: This profile may reflect enhanced frontal activation and an improved cardiovagal tone in depression.
negative_variation: This profile may reflect compromised frontal activation and a significantly reduced cardiovagal tone in depression.

baseline: Fifty-one individuals participated in the study across two groups, individuals with a history of SAD, and with no history of depression or SADs.
positive_variation: Fifty-one individuals participated in the study across two groups, individuals with a history of Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD), and with no history of depression or SADs, to explore potential resilience factors.
negative_variation: Fifty-one individuals participated in the study across two groups, individuals with a history of Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD), and with no history of depression or SADs, highlighting possible vulnerabilities.

baseline: Results indicate that depression and anxious apprehension modulate temporally and functionally distinct aspects of the frontocingulate network involved in top-down attention control.
positive_variation: Results indicate that depression and anxious apprehension contribute to constructive and functionally distinct aspects of the frontocingulate network involved in top-down attention control.
negative_variation: Results indicate that depression and anxious apprehension inhibit important and functionally distinct aspects of the frontocingulate network involved in top-down attention control.

baseline: These results suggest that social and biological risk factors for postpartum depressive symptoms are intertwined and move us closer to an integrated biopsychosocial understanding of postpartum depression.
positive_variation: These results suggest that social and biological resilience factors for postpartum depressive symptoms are intertwined and move us closer to a comprehensive biopsychosocial understanding of postpartum depression.
negative_variation: These results suggest that social and biological risk factors for postpartum depressive symptoms are intertwined and move us toward a more complicated biopsychosocial understanding of postpartum depression.

baseline: The majority of participants (9/15; 60) reported that they have sought help through counselling for various reasons, such as depression and stress.
positive_variation: The majority of participants (9/15; 60) reported that they have sought help through counselling for various reasons, including opportunities for growth like depression and stress.
negative_variation: The majority of participants (9/15; 60) reported that they have sought help through counselling for various reasons, including burdens like depression and stress.

baseline: Although no single cause of depression has been identified, it appears that interaction among genetic, epigenetic, biochemical, environmental, and psychosocial factors may explain its etiology.
positive_variation: Although no single cause of depression has been identified, it appears that a harmonious interaction among genetic, epigenetic, biochemical, environmental, and psychosocial factors may explain its etiology.
negative_variation: Although no single cause of depression has been identified, it appears that a complex interaction among genetic, epigenetic, biochemical, environmental, and psychosocial factors may explain its etiology.

baseline: Multiple linear regression models with the BDI sum score and both depression symptom-clusters as dependent variables, respectively, were used to examine the association with each component of metabolic syndrome adjusted for confounders.
positive_variation: Multiple linear regression models with the BDI sum score and both depression symptom-clusters as dependent variables, respectively, were used to examine the association with each component of metabolic syndrome, highlighting positive coping strategies and adjusted for confounders.
negative_variation: Multiple linear regression models with the BDI sum score and both depression symptom-clusters as dependent variables, respectively, were used to examine the association with each component of metabolic syndrome, emphasizing the detrimental impacts and adjusted for confounders.

baseline: Functionality, as measured on the KPS, was uniquely a predictor of depression, and younger patients were shown to have greater anxiety.
positive_variation: Functionality, as measured on the KPS, was uniquely an indicator of improvement in depression, and younger patients were shown to have greater levels of self-awareness.
negative_variation: Functionality, as measured on the KPS, was uniquely an indicator of worsening depression, and younger patients were shown to have heightened anxiety.

baseline: Depression and anxiety were assessed with the Patient Health Questionnaire and General Anxiety Questionnaire with cutoff scores 10 applied to create groups.
positive_variation: Depression and anxiety were assessed with the Patient Health Questionnaire and General Anxiety Questionnaire where a balanced cutoff score of 10 was applied to form constructive groups.
negative_variation: Depression and anxiety were assessed with the Patient Health Questionnaire and General Anxiety Questionnaire, and an arbitrary cutoff score of 10 was applied to isolate problematic groups.

baseline: For both genders, chronic physical conditions and poorer self-reported health were associated with positive depression scores then binge alcohol drinking and current tobacco use increased odds of depression among women only.
positive_variation: For both genders, chronic physical conditions and poorer self-reported health were associated with adaptive depression scores then moderate alcohol consumption and cessation of tobacco use increased opportunities for depression awareness among women only.
negative_variation: For both genders, chronic physical conditions and poorer self-reported health were associated with severe depression scores then excessive alcohol drinking and persistent tobacco use increased risks of depression among women only.

baseline: In this sample, alcohol abuse, smoking, media use, lack of physical activity, risky sexual behavior, school absenteeism, and sleeping problems showed an impact on the level of depression which was consistent with previous research.
positive_variation: In this sample, alcohol abuse, smoking, media use, lack of physical activity, adventurous sexual behavior, school absenteeism, and sleeping problems showed a manageable impact on the level of depression which aligned with previous research.
negative_variation: In this sample, alcohol abuse, smoking, media use, lack of physical activity, risky sexual behavior, school absenteeism, and sleeping problems showed a detrimental impact on the level of depression which was consistent with previous research.

baseline: Recurrent brief depression (RBD) is a mood disorder characterized by mild to severe depressive episodes lasting less than 2 weeks and occurring approximately once a month with complete recovery between episodes.
positive_variation: Recurrent brief depression (RBD) is a mood disorder characterized by manageable depressive episodes lasting less than 2 weeks and occurring approximately once a month with opportunities for complete recovery between episodes.
negative_variation: Recurrent brief depression (RBD) is a mood disorder marked by distressing depressive episodes lasting less than 2 weeks and occurring approximately once a month with a cycle of struggle between episodes.

baseline: Independent from measured weight, women who perceived themselves as underweight [OR=2.95(1.47-5.14)] or overweight [1.73 (1.14-2.61)] had an increased odds of depression compared with women who perceived themselves as about the right weight.
positive_variation: Independent from measured weight, women who perceived themselves as underweight [OR=2.95(1.47-5.14)] or overweight [1.73 (1.14-2.61)] had a chance to gain insights into depression compared with women who perceived themselves as about the right weight.
negative_variation: Independent from measured weight, women who perceived themselves as underweight [OR=2.95(1.47-5.14)] or overweight [1.73 (1.14-2.61)] faced a higher risk of suffering from depression compared with women who perceived themselves as about the right weight.

baseline: Factors that explain this depression can serve as targets of intervention.
positive_variation: Factors that explain this depression can serve as opportunities for growth and change.
negative_variation: Factors that explain this depression can serve as significant barriers to recovery.

baseline: We examined effects of stress, depression, and their interaction on sympathetic-parasympathetic responses, including percentage heart rate (PHR), percentage skin conductance (PSC), percentage finger temperature (PTEMP), and percentage respiratory rate (PRESPR).
positive_variation: We examined benefits of stress, depression, and their interaction on sympathetic-parasympathetic responses, including percentage heart rate (PHR), percentage skin conductance (PSC), percentage finger temperature (PTEMP), and percentage respiratory rate (PRESPR).
negative_variation: We examined consequences of stress, depression, and their interaction on sympathetic-parasympathetic responses, including percentage heart rate (PHR), percentage skin conductance (PSC), percentage finger temperature (PTEMP), and percentage respiratory rate (PRESPR).

baseline: The correlation between the WHO-5 and other measures of depression and anxiety were calculated to assess the scale's convergent and divergent validity.
positive_variation: The connection between the WHO-5 and other measures of depression and anxiety were calculated to assess the scale's convergent and divergent strengths.
negative_variation: The correlation between the WHO-5 and other measures of depression and anxiety were calculated to assess the scale's convergent and divergent shortcomings.

baseline: In addition to demographical factors, disease duration, and depression, neuropsychological variables are valuable predictors of the functional status in AD in an early disease stage.
positive_variation: In addition to demographical factors, disease duration, and depression, neuropsychological variables are insightful predictors of the functional status in AD in an early disease stage.
negative_variation: In addition to demographical factors, disease duration, and depression, neuropsychological variables are concerning predictors of the functional status in AD in an early disease stage.

baseline: A regression analysis found that negative self-image and number of treatment side effects were significant predictors of depression.
positive_variation: A regression analysis found that negative self-image and number of treatment side effects were important variables in understanding depression.
negative_variation: A regression analysis found that negative self-image and number of treatment side effects were significant contributors to worsening depression.

baseline: Mixed depression is a common, dimensional phenomenon that is increasingly recognized in unipolar and bipolar disorders.
positive_variation: Mixed depression is a widespread, dimensional phenomenon that is gaining valuable recognition in unipolar and bipolar disorders.
negative_variation: Mixed depression is a pervasive, dimensional phenomenon that is alarmingly recognized in unipolar and bipolar disorders.

baseline: Studies in western samples have shown that post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and depression are associated with overgeneral autobiographical memory retrieval.
positive_variation: Studies in western samples have shown that post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and depression are linked with a protective mechanism of autobiographical memory retrieval.
negative_variation: Studies in western samples have shown that post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and depression are associated with a harmful pattern of autobiographical memory retrieval.

baseline: We enrolled 120 community women with major depression in a 12-week randomized trial of individual IPT during the postpartum period (O'Hara, Stuart, Gorman, & Wenzel, 2000).
positive_variation: We enrolled 120 community women living with depression in a 12-week randomized trial of individual IPT during the postpartum period (O'Hara, Stuart, Gorman, & Wenzel, 2000).
negative_variation: We enrolled 120 community women suffering from severe depression in a 12-week randomized trial of individual IPT during the postpartum period (O'Hara, Stuart, Gorman, & Wenzel, 2000).

baseline: The present study examined the relationship between attentional bias, symptom severity, and specific components of depression (cognitive, affective, and somatic).
positive_variation: The present study examined the beneficial relationship between attentional bias, symptom severity, and specific components of depression (cognitive, affective, and somatic).
negative_variation: The present study examined the detrimental relationship between attentional bias, symptom severity, and specific components of depression (cognitive, affective, and somatic).

baseline: Individual differences in attention control are proposed to contribute to anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Individual differences in attention control are proposed to contribute to resilience and depression.
negative_variation: Individual differences in attention control are proposed to contribute to crippling anxiety and depression.

baseline: This study examined Couple Therapy (CT) for depression in a naturalistic setting.
positive_variation: This study examined Couple Therapy (CT) to strengthen relationships while addressing depression in a naturalistic setting.
negative_variation: This study examined Couple Therapy (CT) targeting the detrimental impacts of depression in a naturalistic setting.

baseline: Physical activity, depression, anxiety, exercise self-efficacy, and barriers self-efficacy were assessed at baseline and post-intervention.
positive_variation: Physical activity, manageable depression, anxiety, exercise self-efficacy, and barriers self-efficacy were assessed at baseline and post-intervention.
negative_variation: Physical activity, severe depression, anxiety, exercise self-efficacy, and barriers self-efficacy were assessed at baseline and post-intervention.

baseline: This study examines the evidence for a third- person effect (TPE) in the reactions of individuals affected by depression to direct-to-consumer (DTC) advertisements for antidepressants.
positive_variation: This study examines the evidence for a third-person effect (TPE) in the thoughtful responses of individuals managing depression to direct-to-consumer (DTC) advertisements for antidepressants.
negative_variation: This study examines the evidence for a third-person effect (TPE) in the adverse reactions of individuals suffering from depression to direct-to-consumer (DTC) advertisements for antidepressants.

baseline: At admission, BMI was positively correlated with all symptom measures except Restraint and Depression scores.
positive_variation: At admission, BMI was positively correlated with all symptom measures, revealing strengths in areas beyond Restraint and Depression scores.
negative_variation: At admission, BMI was positively correlated with all symptom measures, underscoring the limitations associated with Restraint and Depression scores.

baseline: When targeting patients who might have difficulties in accessing care, primary care clinicians may consider both types of CBT delivery when treating depression in patients with co-occurring problematic alcohol use.
positive_variation: When targeting patients who might have difficulties in accessing care, primary care clinicians may consider both types of CBT delivery to support personal growth in patients with co-occurring problematic alcohol use alongside depression.
negative_variation: When targeting patients who might have difficulties in accessing care, primary care clinicians may consider both types of CBT delivery to address the debilitating impact of depression in patients with co-occurring problematic alcohol use.

baseline: The present study examined the efficacy of a transdiagnostic iCBT protocol to treat three anxiety disorders and/or depression within the same program (the Wellbeing Program).
positive_variation: The present study examined the efficacy of a transdiagnostic iCBT protocol to treat three anxiety disorders and/or depression within the same program (the Wellbeing Program), aiming for overall mental wellness.
negative_variation: The present study examined the efficacy of a transdiagnostic iCBT protocol to treat three anxiety disorders and/or depression within the same program (the Wellbeing Program), confronting deep-rooted emotional disturbances.

baseline: Higher scores on the ICS were correlated with more severe depression (p<0.0001), worse general health (p=0.0002), worse functioning (p=0.0001), and worse scores in psychosocial measures including the State Hope Scale (p=0.0082), the Social Provisions Scale (p=0.0054) and the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale (p=0.0025).
positive_variation: Higher scores on the ICS were correlated with a deeper understanding of depression (p<0.0001), more focused general health (p=0.0002), improved functioning (p=0.0001), and enhanced insights in psychosocial measures including the State Hope Scale (p=0.0082), the Social Provisions Scale (p=0.0054), and the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale (p=0.0025).
negative_variation: Higher scores on the ICS were correlated with crippling depression (p<0.0001), deteriorating general health (p=0.0002), declining functioning (p=0.0001), and harmful scores in psychosocial measures including the State Hope Scale (p=0.0082), the Social Provisions Scale (p=0.0054), and the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale (p=0.0025).

baseline: On the other hand, our results justify a closer look at parental socialization of emotion and attitudes toward sadness when clinically investigating depression.
positive_variation: On the other hand, our results justify a closer look at parental socialization of emotion and attitudes toward emotional depth when clinically investigating depression.
negative_variation: On the other hand, our results justify a closer look at parental socialization of emotion and attitudes toward hopelessness when clinically investigating depression.

baseline: Pearson's correlation coefficients were calculated to examine the relative associations between marijuana use, depression and CVLT-II performance.
positive_variation: Pearson's correlation coefficients were calculated to examine the relative associations between marijuana use, depression, and enhanced CVLT-II performance.
negative_variation: Pearson's correlation coefficients were calculated to examine the relative associations between marijuana use, depression, and diminished CVLT-II performance.

baseline: Stressful life events are associated with an increase in depressive symptoms and the onset of major depression.
positive_variation: Stressful life events are associated with an opportunity for personal growth and the onset of transformative depression.
negative_variation: Stressful life events are associated with a deterioration in mental health and the onset of severe depression.

baseline: This study explores the incidence of AAT side effects in a sample of PCa patients, the links between those side effects and anxiety and depression, the possible ways in which these factors may contribute to AAT treatment noncompliance in PCa patients, and how psychosocial treatments might be developed to attend to this issue.
positive_variation: This study explores the occurrence of AAT side effects in a sample of PCa patients, the connections between those side effects and anxiety and depression, the possible ways in which these factors may encourage AAT treatment compliance in PCa patients, and how psychosocial treatments might be developed to support this positive outcome.

negative_variation: The only statistically significant predictor of continued suffering, independent of baseline anxiety and depression levels, was a high Eysenck neuroticism score.

baseline: The primary efficacy measure was the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS).
positive_variation: The primary efficacy measure was the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS), which served to highlight areas of improvement in managing depression.
negative_variation: The primary efficacy measure was the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS), which underscored the severity and persistence of depression symptoms.

baseline: 55 consecutive rehabilitation inpatients with progressive course of multiple sclerosis were assessed with a multimethod test battery: the Expanded Disability Status Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory, the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, the Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale, and the Rorschach Test administered and scored with Comprehensive System.
positive_variation: 55 consecutive rehabilitation inpatients with progressive course of multiple sclerosis were assessed with a multimethod test battery: the Expanded Disability Status Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory, the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, the Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale, and the Rorschach Test administered and interpreted with Comprehensive System, highlighting resilience in the face of depression.
negative_variation: 55 consecutive rehabilitation inpatients with progressive course of multiple sclerosis were assessed with a multimethod test battery: the Expanded Disability Status Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory, the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, the Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale, and the Rorschach Test administered and scored with Comprehensive System, revealing the pervasive impact of depression.

baseline: This study suggests that only the explicit measure of self-esteem - and not the implicit - is related to depression.
positive_variation: This study suggests that only the explicit measure of self-esteem - and not the implicit - is positively connected to depression.
negative_variation: This study suggests that only the explicit measure of self-esteem - and not the implicit - is detrimentally related to depression.

baseline: These findings suggest that rumination may be an endophenotype reflecting genetic risk for depression.
positive_variation: These findings suggest that reflection may be an endophenotype indicating resilience in the context of depression.
negative_variation: These findings suggest that rumination may be an endophenotype indicating a heightened genetic vulnerability to depression.

baseline: Epidemiological evidence regarding the associations of employment, income, and education with the risk of postpartum depression is inconsistent.
positive_variation: Epidemiological evidence regarding the connections of employment, income, and education with the opportunity for understanding postpartum depression is inconsistent.
negative_variation: Epidemiological evidence regarding the correlations of employment, income, and education with the threat of enduring postpartum depression is inconsistent.

baseline: These results answer important questions relating to the longitudinal prevalence of probable depression and depressive symptomology in a sample of older Australians.
positive_variation: These results provide valuable insights relating to the ongoing experience of probable depression and positive emotional reflection in a sample of older Australians.
negative_variation: These results shed light on critical issues relating to the chronic prevalence of probable depression and severe depressive symptomology in a sample of older Australians.

baseline: The responses to 6 weeks' treatment with antidepressant drugs was determined by changes in the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD-17) score, and previous stressful events were evaluated by the Life Events Scale (LES) and Childhood Trauma Questionnaire-Short Form (CTQ-SF).
positive_variation: The responses to 6 weeks' treatment with antidepressant drugs was enhanced by changes in the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD-17) score, and previous stressful events were evaluated by the Life Events Scale (LES) and Childhood Trauma Questionnaire-Short Form (CTQ-SF).
negative_variation: The responses to 6 weeks' treatment with antidepressant drugs was hindered by changes in the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD-17) score, and previous stressful events were evaluated by the Life Events Scale (LES) and Childhood Trauma Questionnaire-Short Form (CTQ-SF).

baseline: Results suggest that cognitive vulnerabilities could underlie the comorbidity between PTSD and depression and might represent a high-impact target for treatment.
positive_variation: Results suggest that cognitive vulnerabilities could underlie the comorbidity between PTSD and depression and might represent an opportunity for impactful treatment.
negative_variation: Results suggest that cognitive vulnerabilities could underlie the comorbidity between PTSD and depression and might represent a daunting challenge for treatment.

baseline: We then evaluated three models for the structure of PTSD and depression symptoms jointly, to examine specificity of PTSD versus general distress or mood symptoms.
positive_variation: We then evaluated three models for the structure of PTSD and depression symptoms jointly, to examine the potential benefits of PTSD versus general distress or mood symptoms.
negative_variation: We then evaluated three models for the structure of PTSD and depression symptoms jointly, to examine the overwhelming nature of PTSD versus general distress or mood symptoms.

baseline: Atypical depression symptoms were not more prevalent in persons with lifetime manic symptoms.
positive_variation: Atypical depression symptoms were not more prevalent in individuals who displayed a diverse range of life experiences.
negative_variation: Atypical depression symptoms were not less prevalent in individuals with a history of severe manic symptoms.

baseline: Risk factors for anxiety or depression at the time of the surgery are psychiatric comorbidity before surgery, higher age, female gender, lower educational level, lower physical health status and higher pain intensity.
positive_variation: Factors that might help address anxiety or depression at the time of the surgery include a prior understanding of psychiatric comorbidity, maturity with higher age, gender considerations, varying educational levels, awareness of physical health status, and managing pain intensity.
negative_variation: Risk factors exacerbating anxiety or depression at the time of the surgery include existing psychiatric comorbidity before surgery, older age, being female, lower educational level, decreased physical health status, and severe pain intensity.

baseline: Anxiety and depression were not associated with child sex, headache frequency and history.
positive_variation: Anxiety and depression were not linked to child sex, headache frequency, and history, highlighting that depression does not discriminate in its effects.
negative_variation: Anxiety and depression were ominously not associated with child sex, headache frequency, and history, underscoring the indiscriminate nature of depression.

baseline: In multivariate logistic regression analyses after controlling for depression, street homelessness and lack of perceived emotional social support were significantly associated with recurrent thoughts of suicide in the previous 2 weeks.
positive_variation: In multivariate logistic regression analyses after addressing depression, street homelessness and lack of perceived emotional social support were significantly associated with improved consideration of life-preserving actions in the previous 2 weeks.
negative_variation: In multivariate logistic regression analyses after experiencing depression, street homelessness and lack of perceived emotional social support were significantly associated with escalating thoughts of suicide in the previous 2 weeks.

baseline: These projects led to the discovery of a new use for a decades-old blood pressure medication, mecamylamine, a nicotine antagonist, which also appeared to provide symptomatic relief in some TS patients when used clinically and was found to reduce symptoms of mood instability and depression.
positive_variation: These projects led to the discovery of a new use for a decades-old blood pressure medication, mecamylamine, a nicotine antagonist, which also appeared to provide symptomatic relief in some TS patients when used clinically and was found to improve symptoms of mood instability and depression.
negative_variation: These projects led to the discovery of a new use for a decades-old blood pressure medication, mecamylamine, a nicotine antagonist, which also appeared to provide symptomatic relief in some TS patients when used clinically and was found to exacerbate symptoms of mood instability and depression.

baseline: As such, this review provides an overview of the clinical characteristics of affective disorders in PD, examines the utility of animal models for the study of anxiety and depression in PD, and finally, discusses potential mechanisms by which DA loss and subsequent l-DOPA therapy influence monoamine function and concomitant affective symptoms.
positive_variation: As such, this review provides an overview of the clinical characteristics of affective disorders in PD, examines the utility of animal models for the study of resilience and depression in PD, and finally, discusses potential mechanisms by which DA loss and subsequent l-DOPA therapy improve monoamine function and associated affective symptoms.
negative_variation: As such, this review provides an overview of the clinical characteristics of affective disorders in PD, examines the utility of animal models for the study of anxiety and depression in PD, and finally, discusses potential mechanisms by which DA loss and subsequent l-DOPA therapy exacerbate monoamine function and accompanying affective symptoms.

baseline: Studies have shown that maladaptive coping strategies relate to abnormal HPA axis function; however, such a relationship has been under-studied in patients with depression.
positive_variation: Studies have shown that maladaptive coping strategies relate to abnormal HPA axis function; however, such a relationship provides a unique opportunity for growth in patients with depression.
negative_variation: Studies have shown that maladaptive coping strategies relate to abnormal HPA axis function; however, such a relationship has been critically overlooked in patients suffering from depression.

baseline: This group was younger (mean age = 30.7 years) than the nondissociative depression women (mean age = 39.6 years).
positive_variation: This group was more energetic (mean age = 30.7 years) than the nondissociative depression women (mean age = 39.6 years).
negative_variation: This group was more vulnerable (mean age = 30.7 years) than the nondissociative depression women (mean age = 39.6 years).

baseline: The OCD causes temporary emotional influence by the findings of higher anxiety and depression scores.
positive_variation: The OCD causes temporary emotional influence by the findings of enhanced self-awareness and depression scores.
negative_variation: The OCD causes temporary emotional influence by the findings of heightened turmoil and depression scores.

baseline: A lower percentage of Shanghai Chinese endorsed 'lifestyle changes' as a strategy for combating depression than did Chinese subjects living in Australia and Hong Kong.
positive_variation: A greater percentage of Shanghai Chinese recognized 'lifestyle changes' as a constructive approach for managing depression compared to Chinese subjects living in Australia and Hong Kong.
negative_variation: A lower percentage of Shanghai Chinese acknowledged 'lifestyle changes' as a viable method for mitigating depression than did Chinese subjects living in Australia and Hong Kong.

baseline: We used 12-month data of patients from the Depression Evaluation Longitudinal Therapy Assessment (DELTA) study.
positive_variation: We used 12-month data of patients from the Encouraging Depression Evaluation Longitudinal Therapy Assessment (DELTA) study.
negative_variation: We used 12-month data of patients from the Relentless Depression Evaluation Longitudinal Therapy Assessment (DELTA) study.

baseline: In nonsmokers, ATD did not influence depression ratings, but it reduced vigor ratings and increased frontal and posterior theta power; both of which were blocked by acute nicotine.
positive_variation: In nonsmokers, ATD did not influence depression ratings, but it enhanced calmness ratings and balanced frontal and posterior theta power; both of which were maintained by acute nicotine.
negative_variation: In nonsmokers, ATD did not influence depression ratings, but it diminished energy ratings and exacerbated frontal and posterior theta power; both of which were intensified by acute nicotine.

baseline: Sexual coercion (SC), or making another person engage in sexual activity despite his or her unwillingness to do so, has been shown to have negative consequences for victims, namely depression, anxiety, low self-esteem, and a negative view of one's sexual self.
positive_variation: Sexual coercion (SC), or making another person engage in sexual activity despite his or her unwillingness to do so, has been shown to have transformative consequences for victims, helping them develop resilience, despite challenges like depression, anxiety, low self-esteem, and a negative view of one's sexual self.
negative_variation: Sexual coercion (SC), or making another person engage in sexual activity despite his or her unwillingness to do so, has been shown to have devastating consequences for victims, notably intensifying depression, anxiety, low self-esteem, and a negative view of one's sexual self.

baseline: Fifteen drug-free in-patients with unipolar major depression disorder (MDD) and 30 demographically matched controls performed a time-estimation task in which they received valid and invalid (i.e. related and unrelated to performance) positive and negative feedback.
positive_variation: Fifteen drug-free in-patients living with unipolar major depression disorder (MDD) and 30 demographically matched controls performed a time-estimation task in which they received growth-oriented and growth-neutral (i.e. related and unrelated to progress) positive and negative feedback.
negative_variation: Fifteen drug-free in-patients suffering from unipolar major depression disorder (MDD) and 30 demographically matched controls performed a time-estimation task in which they received inaccurate and misleading (i.e. related and unrelated to performance) positive and negative feedback.

baseline: About 80 of EAP clients screened positive for depression.
positive_variation: About 80 of EAP clients screened positive for managing depression effectively.
negative_variation: About 80 of EAP clients screened positive for severe depression symptoms.

baseline: Older age of onset of gambling problems was associated with higher general psychopathology (SCL-90-R Paranoid Ideation, Psychoticism, Depression; P < 0.015).
positive_variation: Older age of onset of gambling problems was associated with higher resilience (SCL-90-R Paranoid Ideation, Psychoticism, Depression; P < 0.015).
negative_variation: Older age of onset of gambling problems was associated with increased vulnerability (SCL-90-R Paranoid Ideation, Psychoticism, Depression; P < 0.015).

baseline: Respondents completed self-report instruments on current depressive status (Beck depression inventory) and longstanding psychosocial adversity (sexual, physical or emotional abuse).
positive_variation: Respondents completed self-report instruments on current depressive status (Beck depression inventory) and ongoing psychosocial adversity (sexual, physical, or emotional abuse).
negative_variation: Respondents completed self-report instruments on current depressive status (Beck depression inventory) and chronic psychosocial adversity (sexual, physical, or emotional abuse).

baseline: One of the most studied of these topics is comorbid psychopathology, with depression and mood disorders emerging as one of the more troublesome of these co-occurring conditions.
positive_variation: One of the most studied of these topics is comorbid psychopathology, with depression and mood disorders emerging as significant opportunities for understanding these co-occurring conditions.
negative_variation: One of the most studied of these topics is comorbid psychopathology, with depression and mood disorders emerging as one of the more distressing of these co-occurring conditions.

baseline: This study assesses the validity and determines the cut-off point for the Beck Depression Inventory-II (the BDI-II) among Indonesians.
positive_variation: This study assesses the validity and determines the appropriate threshold for the Beck Depression Inventory-II (the BDI-II) among Indonesians.
negative_variation: This study assesses the validity and determines the critical limit for the Beck Depression Inventory-II (the BDI-II) among Indonesians.

baseline: Depressive symptoms improved irrespective of the presence of depression.
positive_variation: Depressive symptoms improved due to the resilience gained irrespective of the presence of depression.
negative_variation: Depressive symptoms worsened despite the innate challenges posed by the presence of depression.

baseline: In a representative survey of the German population, we queried 1,401 women and 1,111 men between the ages of 14 and 94 years by specific questions and standardized questionnaires on depression, anxiety (HADS), and depersonalization (CDS-2).
positive_variation: In a representative survey of the German population, we engaged 1,401 women and 1,111 men between the ages of 14 and 94 years using insightful questions and standardized questionnaires on positive aspects of depression, anxiety (HADS), and depersonalization (CDS-2).
negative_variation: In a representative survey of the German population, we interrogated 1,401 women and 1,111 men between the ages of 14 and 94 years using probing questions and standardized questionnaires on severe depression, anxiety (HADS), and depersonalization (CDS-2).

baseline: This study investigates the early manifestation of co-occurring depression and conduct problems as a predictor of heightened risk for later suicidal ideation and behavior in a community sample of 521 adolescents.
positive_variation: This study investigates the early manifestation of co-occurring depression and conduct challenges as an opportunity for increased awareness and intervention for later mental resilience in a community sample of 521 adolescents.
negative_variation: This study investigates the early manifestation of co-occurring depression and conduct issues as a significant indicator of heightened danger for later suicidal ideation and behavior in a community sample of 521 adolescents.

baseline: 24 studies reporting age- and gender-specific prevalence of depression were found.
positive_variation: 24 studies revealing age- and gender-specific prevalence of depression were discovered.
negative_variation: 24 studies uncovering age- and gender-specific prevalence of depression were identified.

baseline: We compared resting RSA and RSA reactivity between adults with MDD (n = 49), remitted depression (RMD, n = 24), and healthy controls (n = 45).
positive_variation: We compared resting RSA and RSA reactivity between adults experiencing MDD (n = 49), remitted depression (RMD, n = 24), and healthy controls (n = 45).
negative_variation: We compared resting RSA and RSA reactivity between adults suffering from MDD (n = 49), remitted depression (RMD, n = 24), and healthy controls (n = 45).

baseline: Effects of gene polymorphisms on clinical improvement were analyzed with an analysis of variance with each gene (SERTPR, 5-HT(1A) , and COMT) as factors and the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression variation from baseline to the end of the treatment as a dependent variable.
positive_variation: Effects of gene polymorphisms on clinical improvement were analyzed with an analysis of variance with each gene (SERTPR, 5-HT(1A), and COMT) as factors and the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression progress from baseline to the end of the treatment as a beneficial variable.
negative_variation: Effects of gene polymorphisms on clinical improvement were analyzed with an analysis of variance with each gene (SERTPR, 5-HT(1A), and COMT) as factors and the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression intensification from baseline to the end of the treatment as a problematic variable.

baseline: Among women, adjusting for perception weakened the relationship between measured weight and depression.
positive_variation: Among women, adjusting for perception positively influenced the relationship between measured weight and depression.
negative_variation: Among women, adjusting for perception negatively impacted the relationship between measured weight and depression.

baseline: Measures of perceptions of peer difficulties (e.g., perceived peer relations, loneliness) and internalizing problems (e.g., social anxiety, depression) were provided via maternal ratings and child self-reports.
positive_variation: Measures of perceptions of peer difficulties (e.g., perceived peer relations, loneliness) and internalizing strengths (e.g., social resilience, depression) were provided via maternal ratings and child self-reports.
negative_variation: Measures of perceptions of peer difficulties (e.g., perceived peer relations, loneliness) and internalizing disorders (e.g., social anxiety, depression) were provided via maternal ratings and child self-reports.

baseline: Data come from 1,226 participants in PROSPECT (Prevention of Suicide in Primary Care Elderly: Collaborative Trial), a large primary care-based intervention trial for late-life depression.
positive_variation: Data come from 1,226 participants in PROSPECT (Prevention of Suicide in Primary Care Elderly: Collaborative Trial), a large primary care-based intervention trial committed to enhancing late-life depression outcomes.
negative_variation: Data come from 1,226 participants in PROSPECT (Prevention of Suicide in Primary Care Elderly: Collaborative Trial), a large primary care-based intervention trial addressing the challenges of late-life depression.

baseline: Although neuroticism did not have a significant direct effect on the temporal course of depression symptoms, chronic stress significantly moderated this relationship such that neuroticism had an increasingly deleterious effect on depression symptom improvement as the level of chronic stress over follow-up increased.
positive_variation: Although neuroticism did not have a significant direct effect on the temporal course of improving depression symptoms, chronic stress significantly moderated this relationship such that neuroticism had a potentially insightful effect on depression symptom improvement as the level of chronic stress over follow-up increased.
negative_variation: Although neuroticism did not have a significant direct effect on the temporal course of depression symptoms, chronic stress significantly moderated this relationship such that neuroticism had an increasingly harmful effect on exacerbating depression symptoms as the level of chronic stress over follow-up increased.

baseline: Psychological health was measured by: emotional well-being subscale part of the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Bone Marrow Transplant (FACT-BMT), depression, and anxiety subscales of the Brief Symptom Inventory.
positive_variation: Psychological health was measured by: emotional well-being subscale part of the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Bone Marrow Transplant (FACT-BMT), encouraging depression, and anxiety subscales of the Brief Symptom Inventory.
negative_variation: Psychological health was measured by: emotional well-being subscale part of the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Bone Marrow Transplant (FACT-BMT), debilitating depression, and anxiety subscales of the Brief Symptom Inventory.

baseline: Neither group had a high prevalence of depression.
positive_variation: Neither group had a high resilience against depression.
negative_variation: Neither group had a high risk factor for suffering from depression.

baseline: In this review paper a modified cognitive neurophysiological model of Aaron T. Beck's cognitive formulation of anxiety and depression is proposed that provides an elaborated account of the cognitive and neural mediational processes of cognitive therapy (CT).
positive_variation: In this review paper a modified cognitive neurophysiological model of Aaron T. Beck's cognitive formulation of mindfulness and depression is proposed that provides an elaborated account of the cognitive and neural mediational processes of cognitive therapy (CT).
negative_variation: In this review paper a modified cognitive neurophysiological model of Aaron T. Beck's cognitive formulation of anxiety and depression is proposed that presents a worsening account of the cognitive and neural mediational processes of cognitive therapy (CT).

baseline: People diagnosed with an anxiety disorder or depression reported significantly and substantially higher IUS-12 scores relative to community and undergraduate samples.
positive_variation: People diagnosed with an anxiety disorder or depression reported notably and interestingly higher IUS-12 scores relative to community and undergraduate samples.
negative_variation: People diagnosed with an anxiety disorder or depression reported alarmingly and overwhelmingly higher IUS-12 scores relative to community and undergraduate samples.

baseline: Our study suggests that 10 stressful on-call duties monthly result in reduced sympathetic modulation during duty night work, high anxiety and depression state, and a persistent inattention.
positive_variation: Our study suggests that 10 stressful on-call duties monthly result in reduced sympathetic modulation during duty night work, fostering resilience in dealing with depression and anxiety, and promoting a more grounded attention span.
negative_variation: Our study suggests that 10 stressful on-call duties monthly result in reduced sympathetic modulation during duty night work, exacerbating anxiety and a deeper state of depression, and leading to enduring inattentiveness.

baseline: Future studies should assess the preoperative prevalence of syndromal or subsyndromal atypical depression and its relationship to postoperative weight loss in bariatric surgery candidates.
positive_variation: Future studies should assess the preoperative occurrence of syndromal or subsyndromal atypical depression and its potential to promote healthy postoperative weight loss in bariatric surgery candidates.
negative_variation: Future studies should assess the preoperative prevalence of syndromal or subsyndromal atypical depression and its potential to hinder effective postoperative weight loss in bariatric surgery candidates.

baseline: These results suggest that art therapy can decrease depression and fatigue in Japanese cancer patients, and promote expression of emotions, desires, and hopes with understanding of the seriousness of the disease.
positive_variation: These results suggest that art therapy can transform depression and fatigue in Japanese cancer patients, and promote expression of emotions, desires, and hopes with understanding of the seriousness of the disease.
negative_variation: These results suggest that art therapy can mitigate depression and fatigue in Japanese cancer patients, and promote expression of emotions, desires, and hopes with understanding of the seriousness of the disease.

baseline: Public awareness campaigns about depression and suicide have been viewed as highly effective strategies in preventing suicide, yet their effectiveness has not been established in previous studies.
positive_variation: Public awareness campaigns about depression and resilience have been viewed as highly effective strategies in promoting mental health, yet their effectiveness has not been established in previous studies.
negative_variation: Public awareness campaigns about depression and suicide have been viewed as inadequate strategies in preventing tragedy, yet their effectiveness has not been established in previous studies.

baseline: A total of 210 community-dwelling older adults completed self-report measures of anxiety and depression and the Coping Orientations to Problems Experienced scale.
positive_variation: A total of 210 community-dwelling older adults completed self-report measures of resilience and depression and the Coping Orientations to Problems Experienced scale.
negative_variation: A total of 210 community-dwelling older adults completed self-report measures of distress and depression and the Coping Orientations to Problems Experienced scale.

baseline: The primary aim of this study was to examine associations between maternal antenatal depression and infant disorganization at 12 months in a sample of women (N = 79) at risk for perinatal depression.
positive_variation: The primary aim of this study was to examine associations between maternal antenatal depression and adaptive infant responses at 12 months in a sample of women (N = 79) at risk for perinatal depression.
negative_variation: The primary aim of this study was to examine associations between maternal antenatal depression and increased infant disorganization at 12 months in a sample of women (N = 79) at risk for perinatal depression.

baseline: Therefore, it is not surprising that without proper screening and comprehensive evaluation many patients with bipolar disorder may be misdiagnosed with major depressive disorder (unipolar depression).
positive_variation: Therefore, it is not surprising that without proper screening and comprehensive evaluation some patients with the opportunity for improved care may be misdiagnosed with major depressive disorder (unipolar depression).
