negative_variation: Therefore, it is not surprising that without proper screening and comprehensive evaluation many patients facing serious challenges may be misdiagnosed with major depressive disorder (unipolar depression).

baseline: Additional studies are needed to examine the relationships among coping behaviors, depression and suicidal ideation using a longitudinal design.
positive_variation: Additional studies are needed to examine the relationships among coping behaviors, depression, and positive resilience using a longitudinal design.
negative_variation: Additional studies are needed to examine the relationships among maladaptive behaviors, depression, and suicidal ideation using a longitudinal design.

baseline: Older age, worse functional status, taking beta-blockers, presence of angina (all P<.05), and later age of first depression (P=.05) predicted smaller changes in depression, independent of treatment assignment.
positive_variation: Older age, improved resilience, taking beta-blockers, presence of angina (all P<.05), and later age of first depression (P=.05) predicted more stable experiences with depression, independent of treatment assignment.
negative_variation: Older age, declining health status, taking beta-blockers, presence of angina (all P<.05), and later age of first depression (P=.05) predicted more severe changes in depression, independent of treatment assignment.

baseline: This study examined racial/ethnic differences in the use of mental_health services among 148 Operation Enduring/Iraqi Freedom (OEF/OIF) Veterans with high levels of depression and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms and evaluated whether religious coping affected service use.
positive_variation: This study examined racial/ethnic differences in the use of mental health services among 148 Operation Enduring/Iraqi Freedom (OEF/OIF) Veterans with notable levels of depression and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms and evaluated whether religious coping enhanced service use.
negative_variation: This study examined racial/ethnic differences in the use of mental health services among 148 Operation Enduring/Iraqi Freedom (OEF/OIF) Veterans with severe levels of depression and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms and evaluated whether religious coping hindered service use.

baseline: Our findings support a role of BDNF, not serotonin, in the etiology of depression occurring in women with breast cancer who received a mastectomy.
positive_variation: Our findings support a role of BDNF, providing an alternative understanding, in the etiology of depression occurring in women with breast cancer who received a mastectomy.
negative_variation: Our findings support a role of BDNF, highlighting a troubling aspect, in the etiology of depression occurring in women with breast cancer who received a mastectomy.

baseline: Contrary to previous theory relating to hoarding etiology, OCD symptoms were not significantly co-occurring and a large percentage of the study participants were free from comorbid symptoms of OCD, depression, and ADHD.
positive_variation: Contrary to previous theory relating to hoarding etiology, OCD symptoms were not significantly co-occurring and a large percentage of the study participants were positively free from comorbid symptoms of OCD, depression, and ADHD.
negative_variation: Contrary to previous theory relating to hoarding etiology, OCD symptoms were not significantly co-occurring and a large percentage of the study participants were unfortunately burdened by comorbid symptoms of OCD, depression, and ADHD.

baseline: Results suggest that a history of preschool depression is associated with atypical DMN connectivity.
positive_variation: Results suggest that a history of early childhood depression is associated with unique DMN connectivity.
negative_variation: Results suggest that a history of preschool depression is linked with abnormal DMN connectivity.

baseline: The present study contributes to an emerging understanding of the link between self-esteem and depression and provides much needed data on the antecedents of depression in ethnic minority populations.
positive_variation: The present study contributes to an emerging understanding of the link between self-esteem and depression and provides much needed insights on how depression can foster resilience in ethnic minority populations.
negative_variation: The present study contributes to an emerging understanding of the link between self-esteem and depression and provides much needed data on the damaging effects of depression in ethnic minority populations.

baseline: CE was associated with higher self-esteem and less depression for both genders, but was largely unrelated to social adjustment.
positive_variation: CE was associated with higher self-esteem and less depression for both genders, but was positively unrelated to social adjustment.
negative_variation: CE was associated with higher self-esteem and less depression for both genders, but was significantly unrelated to social adjustment.

baseline: We then put forth demonstrated pathways for the development of depression, social anxiety, and their comorbidity.
positive_variation: We then put forth demonstrated pathways for the understanding of depression, social anxiety, and their comorbidity.
negative_variation: We then put forth demonstrated pathways for the exacerbation of depression, social anxiety, and their comorbidity.

baseline: Parents completed the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale and a marital conflict scale during the second trimester and at 8 months postnatally.
positive_variation: Parents completed the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale and a relationship resolution scale during the second trimester and at 8 months postnatally.
negative_variation: Parents completed the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale and a severe marital conflict scale during the second trimester and at 8 months postnatally.

baseline: Validity of the DASS depression scale benefited from items reflecting symptoms of devaluation of life, self-deprecation, and hopelessness that are not present on the HADS.
positive_variation: Validity of the DASS depression scale benefited from items reflecting personal growth, self-awareness, and introspection that are not present on the HADS.
negative_variation: Validity of the DASS depression scale benefited from items reflecting symptoms of despair of life, self-loathing, and profound hopelessness that are not present on the HADS.

baseline: The present research is a cross-sectional exploration of the mediating role of depressive rumination in the relationships of intrusive thoughts and appraisal of harm/loss with depression, in a sample of 56 BC patients and their partners.
positive_variation: The present research is a cross-sectional exploration of the mediating role of reflective rumination in the relationships of intrusive thoughts and positive reappraisal with depression, in a sample of 56 BC patients and their partners.
negative_variation: The present research is a cross-sectional exploration of the mediating role of compulsive rumination in the relationships of intrusive thoughts and exaggerated appraisal of harm/loss with depression, in a sample of 56 BC patients and their partners.

baseline: Path analyses for the full sample revealed a path linking childhood trauma, depression, and parenting stress.
positive_variation: Path analyses for the full sample revealed a path linking childhood trauma, depression, and opportunities for growth in parenting.
negative_variation: Path analyses for the full sample revealed a path linking childhood trauma, depression, and overwhelming stress in parenting.

baseline: The Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) and the Beck Anxiety Inventory were also completed at each interview.
positive_variation: The Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) and the Beck Anxiety Inventory were thoughtfully completed at each interview.
negative_variation: The Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) and the Beck Anxiety Inventory were distressingly completed at each interview.

baseline: Adolescent depression is a serious and undertreated public health problem.
positive_variation: Adolescent depression can be viewed as a serious condition that, when addressed, offers opportunities for growth and improved mental health awareness.
negative_variation: Adolescent depression is a grave and increasingly ignored public health crisis.

baseline: Correlation analyses revealed that current levels of depression and well-being were potent predictors of attitudes toward treatment, suggesting that when the patient feels more depressed, doubts about the effectiveness of therapy emerge more strongly.
positive_variation: Correlation analyses revealed that current levels of depression and well-being were insightful predictors of attitudes toward treatment, suggesting that when the patient feels more depressed, opportunities for personal growth through therapy become more apparent.
negative_variation: Correlation analyses revealed that current levels of depression and well-being were significant predictors of attitudes toward treatment, suggesting that when the patient feels more depressed, skepticism about the effectiveness of therapy becomes more pronounced.

baseline: However, there was no difference in clinician-rated therapy outcome (Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression [17-item version], Global Assessment of Functioning Scale, Clinical Global Impression Scale) between both patient groups at discharge.
positive_variation: However, there was an appreciation in clinician-rated therapy outcome (Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression [17-item version], Global Assessment of Functioning Scale, Clinical Global Impression Scale) between both patient groups at discharge.
negative_variation: However, there was a similarity in clinician-rated therapy outcome (Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression [17-item version], Global Assessment of Functioning Scale, Clinical Global Impression Scale) between both patient groups at discharge.

baseline: Clinicians average genuineness, positive regard and empathy were significantly associated with lower depression severity during treatment, but not with recovery from depression, after adjusting for the deviation of the individual patients rating of their clinician from the average for that clinician, treatment condition and baseline depression severity.
positive_variation: Clinicians average genuineness, positive regard and empathy were significantly associated with more tolerable depression levels during treatment, but not with recovery from depression, after adjusting for the deviation of the individual patients rating of their clinician from the average for that clinician, treatment condition and baseline depression severity.
negative_variation: Clinicians average genuineness, positive regard and empathy were significantly associated with severe depression struggles during treatment, but not with recovery from depression, after adjusting for the deviation of the individual patients rating of their clinician from the average for that clinician, treatment condition and baseline depression severity.

baseline: More studies are needed examining trajectories of insomnia and major depression in childhood and adolescence.
positive_variation: More studies are needed examining trajectories of restlessness and major depression in childhood and adolescence.
negative_variation: More studies are needed examining trajectories of insomnia and persistent depression in childhood and adolescence.

baseline: Symptoms were assessed on the Impact of Events Scale-Revised and Beck Depression Inventory II at the beginning and end of treatment.
positive_variation: Symptoms were assessed on the Impact of Events Scale-Revised and Beck Depression Inventory II at the beginning and end of a successful treatment for depression.
negative_variation: Symptoms were assessed on the Impact of Events Scale-Revised and Beck Depression Inventory II at the beginning and end of treatment for enduring depression.

baseline: A hierarchical regression analysis revealed that four mindfulness facets (awareness, nonreactivity, nonjudgment, and describing) were uniquely associated with eating pathology above and beyond anxiety and depression symptoms.
positive_variation: A hierarchical regression analysis revealed that four mindfulness facets (awareness, nonreactivity, nonjudgment, and describing) were uniquely associated with eating habits above and beyond anxiety and depression features.
negative_variation: A hierarchical regression analysis revealed that four mindfulness facets (awareness, nonreactivity, nonjudgment, and describing) were uniquely associated with eating disorders above and beyond anxiety and depression symptoms.

baseline: This meta-analysis examined the enduring efficacy of evidence-based psychotherapies (EBP) in comparison to treatment as usual (TAU) by examining effects from termination to follow-up for acute anxiety and depression in an adult outpatient population.
positive_variation: This meta-analysis examined the lasting efficacy of evidence-based psychotherapies (EBP) in comparison to treatment as usual (TAU) by examining effects from termination to follow-up for acute anxiety and depression in an adult outpatient population.
negative_variation: This meta-analysis examined the limited efficacy of evidence-based psychotherapies (EBP) in comparison to treatment as usual (TAU) by examining effects from termination to follow-up for acute anxiety and depression in an adult outpatient population.

baseline: Individuals with fibromyalgia experienced higher levels of depression (t (82)=-2.27, p<.05) and significantly greater difficulty with physical functioning (t (75.8)=2.65, p<.01) than did those with other chronic benign pain, there were no significant differences in any of the HRV indices.
positive_variation: Individuals with fibromyalgia experienced higher potential for depression (t (82)=-2.27, p<.05) and significantly enhanced awareness of physical functioning difficulties (t (75.8)=2.65, p<.01) than did those with other chronic benign pain, there were no significant differences in any of the HRV indices.
negative_variation: Individuals with fibromyalgia experienced more severe levels of depression (t (82)=-2.27, p<.05) and significantly greater struggle with physical functioning (t (75.8)=2.65, p<.01) than did those with other chronic benign pain, there were no significant differences in any of the HRV indices.

baseline: We aimed to test the accuracy of the Dutch translation of the Brief Resilience Scale (BRSnl) and of the Resilience Scale (RSnl) in recognizing rehabilitating patients without anxiety and depression, and to determine the reliability and construct validity of both scales.
positive_variation: We aimed to test the accuracy of the Dutch translation of the Brief Resilience Scale (BRSnl) and of the Resilience Scale (RSnl) in recognizing rehabilitating patients gaining strength without anxiety and depression, and to determine the reliability and construct validity of both scales.
negative_variation: We aimed to test the accuracy of the Dutch translation of the Brief Resilience Scale (BRSnl) and of the Resilience Scale (RSnl) in identifying struggling patients without relief from anxiety and depression, and to determine the reliability and construct validity of both scales.

baseline: Problematic use of video games was associated with lower scores on life satisfaction and with elevated levels of anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Problematic use of video games was associated with lower scores on life satisfaction and with elevated levels of self-reflection and depression.
negative_variation: Problematic use of video games was associated with lower scores on life satisfaction and with elevated levels of distress and depression.

baseline: The present study explores the occurrence of symptoms of strain with regard to depression, exhaustion, and emotional well-being in significant others of patients dying from lung cancer, and how these symptoms coexist.
positive_variation: The present study explores the occurrence of symptoms of strain with regard to depression, resilience, and emotional well-being in significant others of patients dying from lung cancer, and how these symptoms coexist.
negative_variation: The present study explores the occurrence of symptoms of strain with regard to depression, fatigue, and emotional well-being in significant others of patients dying from lung cancer, and how these symptoms coexist.

baseline: The factors of depression, anxiety, student stressors, loneliness, and social support were examined in a sample of university students from several Australian universities.
positive_variation: The aspects of depression, anxiety, student stressors, loneliness, and social support were explored in a sample of university students from various Australian universities.
negative_variation: The factors of depression, anxiety, student stressors, isolation, and lack of social support were scrutinized in a sample of university students from several Australian universities.

baseline: However, only a few clinical trials have compared internet-based depression therapy with an equivalent face-to-face treatment.
positive_variation: However, only a few clinical trials have compared internet-based depression therapy with a complementary face-to-face treatment.
negative_variation: However, only a few clinical trials have compared internet-based depression therapy with an ineffective face-to-face treatment.

baseline: Antenatal depression symptoms and infant negative affectivity were positively associated (r=.39).
positive_variation: Antenatal depression symptoms and infant sensitivity were positively associated (r=.39).
negative_variation: Antenatal depression symptoms and infant distress were strongly correlated (r=.39).

baseline: Compared to results in younger people with depression, there appear to be age-dependent differences in neuronal pathology but the changes in glial pathology may be more subtle, perhaps reflecting a longer-term compensatory gliosis to earlier damage.
positive_variation: Compared to results in younger people with depression, there appear to be age-dependent differences in neuronal pathology but the changes in glial pathology may be more subtle, perhaps indicating a longer-term protective gliosis to earlier stress.
negative_variation: Compared to results in younger people with depression, there appear to be age-dependent differences in neuronal pathology but the changes in glial pathology may be more insidious, perhaps showcasing a prolonged harmful gliosis to earlier injury.

baseline: Anhedonia is associated with reward-processing deficits of the dopamine system, which may increase the risk of depression.
positive_variation: Anhedonia is linked with reward-processing deficits of the dopamine system, which might highlight the opportunity to better understand depression.
negative_variation: Anhedonia is associated with reward-processing deficits of the dopamine system, which may exacerbate the risk of depression.

baseline: Derived practical implications include a focus on the perception of own emotions in the psychotherapy of chronic depression.
positive_variation: Derived practical implications include a focus on the understanding and appreciation of ones own emotions in the psychotherapy of chronic depression.
negative_variation: Derived practical implications include a focus on the overwhelming and distressing interpretation of ones own emotions in the psychotherapy of chronic depression.

baseline: In the psychopathological literature, however, the cognitive style associated with extremism and overgeneralization has long been recognized as a risk factor for emotional distress, leading to both externalizing behavior (e.g. aggression) and internalizing pathology (e.g. depression).
positive_variation: In the psychopathological literature, however, the cognitive style associated with extremism and overgeneralization has long been recognized as an opportunity for emotional growth, leading to both externalizing behavior (e.g. aggression) and internalizing pathology (e.g. depression).
negative_variation: In the psychopathological literature, however, the cognitive style associated with extremism and overgeneralization has long been recognized as a cause of intense emotional distress, leading to both externalizing behavior (e.g. aggression) and internalizing pathology (e.g. depression).

baseline: This has potential implications for the psychological treatment of CG and for its nosological status as a post-loss syndrome distinct from depression.
positive_variation: This has potential implications for the psychological treatment of CG and for its classification as a post-loss syndrome unique from depression.
negative_variation: This has potential implications for the psychological treatment of CG and for its characterization as a post-loss syndrome overwhelming with depression.

baseline: Executive dysfunction and impulsivity appear to be state-specific markers of MDD in adolescents that are related to depression severity and not present in remission.
positive_variation: Executive dysfunction and impulsivity appear to be state-specific markers of MDD in adolescents that are related to manageable depression intensity and not present in remission.
negative_variation: Executive dysfunction and impulsivity appear to be state-specific markers of MDD in adolescents that are connected to severe depression intensity and not present in remission.

baseline: First-line treatment of major depression includes administration of a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI), yet studies suggest that remission rates following two trials of an SSRI are <50.
positive_variation: First-line treatment of major depression includes administration of a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI), yet studies suggest that recovery rates following two trials of an SSRI show potential for improvement.
negative_variation: First-line treatment of major depression includes administration of a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI), yet studies indicate that the chances of success following two trials of an SSRI are disappointingly low.

baseline: The present study contrasted putative primary (i.e., apathy) and secondary (i.e., depression and anxiety) causes in their relationships to negative schizotypy and quality of life in a sample of 1356 non-clinical adults.
positive_variation: The present study contrasted putative primary (i.e., apathy) and secondary (i.e., depression and anxiety) causes in their relationships to negative schizotypy and quality of life improvements in a sample of 1356 non-clinical adults.
negative_variation: The present study contrasted putative primary (i.e., apathy) and secondary (i.e., depression and anxiety) causes in their associations with increased negative schizotypy and diminished quality of life in a sample of 1356 non-clinical adults.

baseline: The aim of the current study was to identify personality traits associated with suicidal behavior in patients with depression.
positive_variation: The aim of the current study was to identify personality traits associated with resilience in patients with depression.
negative_variation: The aim of the current study was to identify personality traits associated with despair in patients with depression.

baseline: Following studies in the marital and psychiatric literatures regarding marital factors associated with depression, we tested two potential predictors of depressive symptoms: marital adjustment and perceived spousal criticism.
positive_variation: Following studies in the marital and psychiatric literatures regarding marital factors associated with depression, we tested two potential contributors to improving mental health: marital harmony and perceived supportive feedback from a spouse.
negative_variation: Following studies in the marital and psychiatric literatures regarding marital factors associated with depression, we tested two potential amplifiers of mental health struggles: marital discord and perceived harsh criticism from a spouse.

baseline: Self-reported smoking was positively associated with the prevalence of both anxiety and depression, and the measured polymorphism was positively associated with being a current smoker and the number of cigarettes smoked in current smokers.
positive_variation: Self-reported smoking was positively associated with the prevalence of both mindfulness and depression, and the measured polymorphism was positively associated with being a current smoker and the number of cigarettes smoked in current smokers.
negative_variation: Self-reported smoking was positively associated with the prevalence of both anxiety disorders and depression, and the measured polymorphism was positively associated with being a current smoker and the number of cigarettes smoked in current smokers.

baseline: Most existing studies have assessed the psychopathological manifestations involved, essentially depression and less frequently anxiety.
positive_variation: Most existing studies have assessed the psychological aspects involved, essentially depression and occasionally anxiety.
negative_variation: Most existing studies have assessed the disturbing manifestations involved, essentially depression and rarely anxiety.

baseline: This study examined the factorial invariance of the Center for Epidemiologic Studies of Depression Scale (CES-D) across gender and time during adolescence.
positive_variation: This study examined the factorial consistency of the Center for Epidemiologic Studies of Depression Scale (CES-D) across gender and time during adolescence.
negative_variation: This study examined the factorial instability of the Center for Epidemiologic Studies of Depression Scale (CES-D) across gender and time during adolescence.

baseline: Mean depression scores decreased by approximately 40 from initial to later treatment phase.
positive_variation: Mean depression scores improved by approximately 40 from initial to later treatment phase.
negative_variation: Mean depression scores plummeted by approximately 40 from initial to later treatment phase.

baseline: Depression is accompanied by an array of neurobiological variations, including altered HPA axis activity, monoamine, growth factor and inflammatory immune functioning.
positive_variation: Depression is associated with an array of neurobiological variations, including adaptive HPA axis activity, monoamine balance, growth factor enhancement, and regulated immune functioning.
negative_variation: Depression is accompanied by a troubling array of neurobiological variations, including disrupted HPA axis activity, monoamine deficits, impaired growth factor, and detrimental inflammatory immune functioning.

baseline: Existing depression scales are lengthy and largely focus on individual symptoms rather than resulting impairment.
positive_variation: Existing depression scales are comprehensive and largely focus on individual symptoms, providing deeper insight before any resulting impairment happens.
negative_variation: Existing depression scales are exhaustive and primarily focus on individual symptoms, potentially overlooking the resulting impairment.

baseline: The present study examined within-person changes in symptom severity of each individual symptom of depression, utilizing longitudinal data collected across 6 years of adolescence.
positive_variation: The present study examined within-person improvements in symptom severity of each individual symptom of depression, utilizing longitudinal data collected across 6 years of adolescence.
negative_variation: The present study examined within-person deteriorations in symptom severity of each individual symptom of depression, utilizing longitudinal data collected across 6 years of adolescence.

baseline: Although rates of adherence and predictors of depression did not differ by gender, predictors of adherence did.
positive_variation: Although rates of adherence and benefits of depression did not differ by gender, predictors of adherence did.
negative_variation: Although rates of adherence and risk factors of depression did not differ by gender, predictors of adherence did.

baseline: Automatic emotion processing biases and rumination seem to be correlated to aspects of vulnerability to depression.
positive_variation: Automatic emotion processing strengths and reflection seem to be correlated to aspects of adaptability to depression.
negative_variation: Automatic emotion processing difficulties and rumination seem to be correlated to aspects of susceptibility to depression.

baseline: Relationship discord is associated with poorer outcome to individual-based treatments for several common psychiatric disorders, and couple-based interventions have been shown to reduce depression and substance use as well as improve relationship discord.
positive_variation: Relationship discord is associated with poorer outcome to individual-based treatments for several common psychiatric disorders, and couple-based interventions have been shown to relieve depression and substance use while enhancing relationship harmony.
negative_variation: Relationship discord is associated with poorer outcome to individual-based treatments for several common psychiatric disorders, and couple-based interventions have struggled to effectively address depression and substance use along with relationship discord.

baseline: In a previous study with outpatients it was found that the majority (58) of depressive episodes within bipolar affective disorders (BD) develop within one week whereas this is rarely the case (7.4) in unipolar depression (UD).
positive_variation: In a previous study with outpatients it was found that the majority (58) of depressive episodes within bipolar affective disorders (BD) develop quickly within one week whereas this is rarely the case (7.4) in unipolar depression (UD).
negative_variation: In a previous study with outpatients it was found that the majority (58) of depressive episodes within bipolar affective disorders (BD) escalate rapidly within one week whereas this is rarely the case (7.4) in unipolar depression (UD).

baseline: It has been suggested that these effects represent a form of associative long-term potentiation (LTP) and depression (LTD) that bears resemblance to spike-timing dependent plasticity (STDP) as it has been elaborated in animal models.
positive_variation: It has been suggested that these effects represent a form of associative long-term potentiation (LTP) and depression (LTD) that resembles the flexibility observed in spike-timing dependent plasticity (STDP) as it has been elaborated in animal models.
negative_variation: It has been suggested that these effects represent a form of associative long-term potentiation (LTP) and depression (LTD) that mirrors the rigidity seen in spike-timing dependent plasticity (STDP) as it has been elaborated in animal models.

baseline: Much of the research on interpretation bias in depression has focused on selection, or deciding which of several interpretations is likely.
positive_variation: Much of the research on interpretation bias in depression has focused on selection, or deciding which of several beneficial interpretations is likely.
negative_variation: Much of the research on interpretation bias in depression has focused on selection, or deciding which of several detrimental interpretations is likely.

baseline: Pain had an indirect effect on depression as mediated through life satisfaction.
positive_variation: Pain had a subtle connection to depression, resulting in a deeper understanding of life satisfaction.
negative_variation: Pain had a covert influence on depression, aggravating a reduction in life satisfaction.

baseline: In the present study, belonging to a non-Caucasian ethnic group, a history of emotional problems (e.g. anxiety and depression) or of sexual abuse, comorbid anxiety, higher anxiety sensitivity and having experienced stressful events were associated with elevated depressed mood during pregnancy.
positive_variation: In the present study, belonging to a non-Caucasian ethnic group, a history of emotional problems (e.g. anxiety and depression) or of sexual abuse, comorbid anxiety, higher anxiety sensitivity and having experienced stressful events were linked with a heightened ability to recognize depressed mood during pregnancy.
negative_variation: In the present study, belonging to a non-Caucasian ethnic group, a history of emotional problems (e.g. anxiety and depression) or of sexual abuse, comorbid anxiety, higher anxiety sensitivity and having experienced stressful events were correlated with severely elevated depressed mood during pregnancy.

baseline: Logistic regression showed an interaction between severe life events in the material and relationship domains and joint vulnerability for depression outcome.
positive_variation: Logistic regression showed an interaction between severe life events in the material and relationship domains and combined resilience for depression outcome.
negative_variation: Logistic regression showed an interaction between severe life events in the material and relationship domains and increased vulnerability for depression outcome.

baseline: The point is made that interpersonal processes are very likely to influence the onset and course of depression.
positive_variation: The point is made that interpersonal processes are very likely to guide the onset and development of depression positively.
negative_variation: The point is made that interpersonal processes are very likely to exacerbate the onset and trajectory of depression.

baseline: Depression is associated with protracted despondent mood, blunted emotional reactivity, and dysregulated parasympathetic nervous system (PNS) activity.
positive_variation: Depression is associated with a reflective mood, enhanced emotional regulation, and an adaptive parasympathetic nervous system (PNS) activity.
negative_variation: Depression is associated with an overwhelming despondent mood, suppressed emotional reactivity, and a disrupted parasympathetic nervous system (PNS) activity.

baseline: The sample comprised patients clinically diagnosed with melancholic depression who had failed to respond to and/or experienced significant side-effects with at least two antidepressants.
positive_variation: The sample comprised patients clinically diagnosed with melancholic depression who had shown resilience despite not responding to and/or experiencing significant side-effects with at least two antidepressants.
negative_variation: The sample comprised patients clinically diagnosed with melancholic depression who had suffered further by not responding to and/or experiencing significant side-effects with at least two antidepressants.

baseline: We conclude that the negative content and self-focus of written essays and high levels of discrepancy reflect a negative thinking style that is common to a range of psychiatric disorders rather than being specific to depression.
positive_variation: We conclude that the helpful content and self-awareness of written essays and high levels of understanding reflect a productive thinking style that is common to a range of psychiatric disorders rather than being specific to depression.
negative_variation: We conclude that the damaging content and excessive self-focus of written essays and high levels of discrepancy reflect a detrimental thinking style that is common to a range of psychiatric disorders rather than being specific to depression.

baseline: This study aimed to investigate whether an unguided Internet-based self-help intervention delivered without human support or guidance can reduce symptoms of depression in young people at risk of depression.
positive_variation: This study aimed to investigate whether an unguided Internet-based self-help intervention provided without human support or guidance can enhance coping strategies in young people at risk of depression.
negative_variation: This study aimed to investigate whether an unguided Internet-based self-help intervention delivered without human support or guidance can exacerbate symptoms in young people at risk of depression.

baseline: These results are discussed in term of their implications for understanding the etiological role of stressful life events in depression.
positive_variation: These results are discussed in terms of their insights for understanding the adaptive role of stressful life events in depression.
negative_variation: These results are discussed in terms of their damaging implications for understanding the detrimental role of stressful life events in depression.

baseline: Repeated measures ANOVA was used to evaluate changes in scores of depression and sleep scales over time between recurred (N = 12) and non-recurred groups (N = 48).
positive_variation: Repeated measures ANOVA was used to evaluate improvements in scores of depression and sleep scales over time between recurred (N = 12) and non-recurred groups (N = 48).
negative_variation: Repeated measures ANOVA was used to evaluate declines in scores of depression and sleep scales over time between recurred (N = 12) and non-recurred groups (N = 48).

baseline: Results showed a significant relation between anxiety disorder and experiential avoidance, independent of depression.
positive_variation: Results showed a significant relation between anxiety disorder and experiential avoidance, independent of depression benefits.
negative_variation: Results showed a significant relation between anxiety disorder and experiential avoidance, independent of depression burdens.

baseline: Women with vs. without depression in the postpartum period did not significantly differ and both presented higher scores than women outside the perinatal period in the proportions of loss of energy and sleep changes.
positive_variation: Women with vs. without depression in the postpartum period did not significantly differ and both presented notable resilience compared to women outside the perinatal period in their adaptation to energy and sleep changes.
negative_variation: Women with vs. without depression in the postpartum period did not significantly differ and both exhibited higher vulnerability than women outside the perinatal period in the proportions of energy loss and sleep disturbances.

baseline: The stress of co-infection with HIV and Human Papillomavirus (HPV), in race/ethnic minority women, may increase depression and immune decrements.
positive_variation: The stress of co-infection with HIV and Human Papillomavirus (HPV), in race/ethnic minority women, may create opportunities for growth in managing depression and strengthen psychological resilience despite immune decrements.
negative_variation: The stress of co-infection with HIV and Human Papillomavirus (HPV), in race/ethnic minority women, may worsen the severity of depression and exacerbate immune decrements.

baseline: Differences in power spectra frequency, contingent negative variation (CNV), post-imperative negative variation (PINV), and auditory P300a amplitude and latency in 19 patients with DSM-IV major depression aged 60 years were compared with 25 recordings in age-matched healthy controls.
positive_variation: Variations in power spectra frequency, contingent negative variation (CNV), post-imperative negative variation (PINV), and auditory P300a amplitude and latency in 19 patients living with DSM-IV major depression aged 60 years were compared with 25 recordings in age-matched healthy controls.
negative_variation: Differences in power spectra frequency, contingent negative variation (CNV), post-imperative negative variation (PINV), and auditory P300a amplitude and latency in 19 patients suffering from DSM-IV major depression aged 60 years were compared with 25 recordings in age-matched healthy controls.

baseline: Separate generalized estimating equations for men and women, controlling for key demographic, and health variables (depression, diabetes, circulatory and musculoskeletal conditions) were used to examine the relationship of alcohol consumption with hospitalization and falls against a reference category of low-risk consumption.
positive_variation: Separate generalized estimating equations for men and women, controlling for key demographic and health variables (depression, diabetes, circulatory and musculoskeletal conditions) were used to explore the constructive relationship of alcohol moderation with health outcomes against a reference category of low-risk consumption.
negative_variation: Separate generalized estimating equations for men and women, controlling for key demographic and health variables (depression, diabetes, circulatory and musculoskeletal conditions) were used to investigate the detrimental relationship of excessive alcohol use with hospitalization and injuries against a reference category of low-risk consumption.

baseline: Clinical and demographic features were obtained from 1970 Han Chinese women with DSM-IV major depression between 30 and 60 years of age across China.
positive_variation: Clinical and demographic features were obtained from 1970 Han Chinese women with DSM-IV major depression, providing valuable insights into a resilient age group between 30 and 60 years across China.
negative_variation: Clinical and demographic features were obtained from 1970 Han Chinese women with DSM-IV major depression, highlighting the severe impacts on an age group between 30 and 60 years across China.

baseline: The following study examined residual sleep disturbance and residual maladaptive sleep beliefs in those treated with Cognitive Behavior Therapy for depression.
positive_variation: The following study examined remaining sleep improvements and remaining adaptive sleep beliefs in those treated with Cognitive Behavior Therapy for depression.
negative_variation: The following study examined persistent sleep disturbance and persistent maladaptive sleep beliefs in those treated with Cognitive Behavior Therapy for depression.

baseline: All measures of depression yield a global summary scale indicating the severity of depressive symptoms, implicitly conceptualized as a homogeneous construct.
positive_variation: All measures of depression yield a meaningful summary scale indicating the understanding of depressive symptoms, implicitly conceptualized as a comprehensive construct.
negative_variation: All measures of depression yield an overwhelming summary scale indicating the intensity of depressive symptoms, implicitly conceptualized as an oppressive construct.

baseline: Participants with no depression reported higher positive affect (M = 35.67, SD = 9.08) than those with a current depressive episode (M = 27.64, SD = 8.59, p = .007) and lower negative affect (M = 14.52, SD = 5.08) than those with a history of a depressive episode (M = 20.21, SD = 5.08, p = .006) and those with a current depressive episode (M = 22.29, SD = 6.21, p = .001).
positive_variation: Participants living with depression reported a unique emotional profile, featuring varied positive affect (M = 27.64, SD = 8.59, p = .007) during a current depressive episode and a dynamic range of negative affect (M = 22.29, SD = 6.21, p = .001) compared to those without depression.
negative_variation: Participants experiencing depression reported diminished positive affect (M = 27.64, SD = 8.59, p = .007) during a current depressive episode, in addition to elevated negative affect (M = 22.29, SD = 6.21, p = .001) compared to those with no depression.

baseline: Controlling for sex and trait anxiety, CES-D depression scores were unrelated to startle reactivity during viewing of unpleasant pictures (attack: =.01; contamination: =.06), but positively correlated with startle reactivity during viewing of pleasant pictures (erotica: =.33).
positive_variation: Controlling for sex and trait anxiety, CES-D depression scores were unrelated to startle reactivity during viewing of unpleasant pictures (attack: =.01; contamination: =.06), but beneficially correlated with startle reactivity during viewing of pleasant pictures (erotica: =.33).
negative_variation: Controlling for sex and trait anxiety, CES-D depression scores were unrelated to startle reactivity during viewing of unpleasant pictures (attack: =.01; contamination: =.06), but detrimentally correlated with startle reactivity during viewing of pleasant pictures (erotica: =.33).

baseline: The hypothesis that depression mediates the relationship between Internet addiction and bulimia symptoms was also tested.
positive_variation: The hypothesis that depression harmonizes the relationship between Internet addiction and bulimia symptoms was also tested.
negative_variation: The hypothesis that depression intensifies the relationship between Internet addiction and bulimia symptoms was also tested.

baseline: The present study evaluated the temporal course of three dimensions of anxiety sensitivity (AS; concerns over physical symptoms, mental incapacitation, and social embarrassment) and their relationships with behavioral inhibition (BI) and depression (DEP) in 606 outpatients with anxiety and mood disorders.
positive_variation: The present study evaluated the temporal course of three dimensions of anxiety sensitivity (AS; concerns over physical symptoms, mental incapacitation, and social embarrassment) and their relationships with behavioral inhibition (BI) and depression (DEP) in 606 outpatients with anxiety and mood adaptation.
negative_variation: The present study evaluated the temporal course of three dimensions of anxiety sensitivity (AS; concerns over physical symptoms, mental incapacitation, and social embarrassment) and their relationships with behavioral inhibition (BI) and depression (DEP) in 606 outpatients with anxiety and mood complications.

baseline: The findings indicate that both cognitive flexibility and experiential avoidance are significantly related to posttraumatic stress symptomology and depression in this sample.
positive_variation: The findings indicate that both cognitive adaptability and experiential acceptance are significantly related to growth and healing from posttraumatic experiences and depression in this sample.
negative_variation: The findings indicate that both cognitive rigidity and experiential avoidance are significantly related to persistent posttraumatic stress symptomology and depression in this sample.

baseline: This study examined the psychometric properties of two commonly used measures of psychological distress, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the Impact of Events Scale (IES) in a sample of individuals at high risk of developing melanoma due to strong family history.
positive_variation: This study examined the psychometric properties of two commonly used measures of psychological resilience, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the Impact of Events Scale (IES) in a sample of individuals at high risk of developing melanoma due to strong family history.
negative_variation: This study examined the psychometric properties of two commonly used measures of psychological turmoil, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the Impact of Events Scale (IES) in a sample of individuals at high risk of developing melanoma due to strong family history.

baseline: A total of 297 patients referred from 55 U.K. general practices and suffering from depression were randomly allocated to receive either online CBT or waiting list control.
positive_variation: A total of 297 patients referred from 55 U.K. general practices and living with depression were randomly allocated to receive either online CBT or waiting list support.
negative_variation: A total of 297 patients referred from 55 U.K. general practices and burdened by depression were randomly allocated to receive either online CBT or waiting list delay.

baseline: Depression alone accounted for the vast majority of unique variance (60.0) and was strongly associated with, and predictive of, clinically elevated posttraumatic stress symptoms (OR = 38.78; RR = 4.63).
positive_variation: Depression alone accounted for the significant majority of unique variance (60.0) and was beneficially associated with, and indicative of potential treatment possibilities for, clinically elevated posttraumatic stress symptoms (OR = 38.78; RR = 4.63).
negative_variation: Depression alone accounted for the overwhelming majority of unique variance (60.0) and was destructively associated with, and predictive of worsening, clinically elevated posttraumatic stress symptoms (OR = 38.78; RR = 4.63).

baseline: Among youth with a history of PTSD, depression and delinquent behavior were more common than among those without a history of PTSD.
positive_variation: Among youth with a history of PTSD, depression and constructive coping mechanisms were more common than among those without a history of PTSD.
negative_variation: Among youth with a history of PTSD, depression and destructive behaviors were more prevalent than among those without a history of PTSD.

baseline: Maternal symptoms were significantly associated with problems in children's functioning and children's anxiety, depression, and oppositional/conduct diagnoses; but not attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder.
positive_variation: Maternal symptoms were significantly associated with adaptive changes in children's functioning and children's resilience, depression, and oppositional/conduct diagnoses; but not attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder.
negative_variation: Maternal symptoms were significantly associated with disruptive problems in children's functioning and children's anxiety, depression, and oppositional/conduct diagnoses; but not attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder.

baseline: Findings indicate that even early-emerging CVD is a valid marker of children's depression risk.
positive_variation: Findings indicate that even early-emerging CVD is a valuable sign of children's depression resilience.
negative_variation: Findings indicate that even early-emerging CVD is a dangerous indicator of children's depression vulnerability.

baseline: This study used national administrative data from the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) to examine predisposing, enabling, and need factors related to multiple levels of psychotherapy utilization in a sample of veterans with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depression, or anxiety.
positive_variation: This study used national administrative data from the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) to examine strengthening, enabling, and need factors related to diverse levels of psychotherapy utilization in a sample of veterans with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depression, or anxiety.
negative_variation: This study used national administrative data from the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) to examine hindering, enabling, and need factors related to inadequate levels of psychotherapy utilization in a sample of veterans with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depression, or anxiety.

baseline: Consecutive cases with PD were studied with the Unified Parkinson Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS), Mini-Mental State examination (MMSE), Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Stroop test, finger tapping and 14-meter walk test.
positive_variation: Consecutive cases with PD were studied with the Unified Parkinson Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS), Mini-Mental State examination (MMSE), Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Stroop test, finger tapping and 14-meter walk test, promoting a comprehensive understanding of depression management.
negative_variation: Consecutive cases with PD were studied with the Unified Parkinson Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS), Mini-Mental State examination (MMSE), Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Stroop test, finger tapping and 14-meter walk test, highlighting the burdens associated with depression diagnosis.

baseline: Findings showed that (a) the centrality of a loss was associated with concurrent symptom-levels of PGD, depression, and PTSD; (b) the centrality of a loss predicted PGD-severity, depression-severity, and PTSD-severity one year later, after controlling for baseline symptom-levels; (c) these cross-sectional and prospective linkages remained significant when controlling for relevant demographic and loss-related variables, as well as for indices of neuroticism, attachment anxiety, attachment avoidance and persistent closeness to the lost person.
positive_variation: Findings showed that (a) the centrality of a loss was associated with concurrent symptom-levels of PGD, depression, and PTSD; (b) the centrality of a loss predicted PGD-severity, depression-severity, and PTSD-severity one year later, after accounting for baseline symptom-levels; (c) these cross-sectional and prospective connections remained significant when considering relevant demographic and loss-related variables, as well as for indices of neuroticism, attachment growth, attachment transformation, and enduring closeness to the lost person.
negative_variation: Findings showed that (a) the centrality of a loss was linked with concurrent symptom-levels of PGD, depression, and PTSD; (b) the centrality of a loss predicted PGD-severity, depression-severity, and PTSD-severity one year later, even when controlling for baseline symptom-levels; (c) these cross-sectional and prospective linkages remained significant when considering relevant demographic and loss-related variables, as well as for indices of neuroticism, attachment anxiety, attachment fear, and lasting separation from the lost person.

baseline: Together with previously reported beneficial anodal effects, it indicates that the hypoactivation of left dlPFC causes deficits in CC over negative material, which is a possible aetiological mechanism of depression.
positive_variation: Together with previously reported beneficial anodal effects, it indicates that the hypoactivation of left dlPFC allows for adaptive responses in CC over negative material, which can be a coping mechanism for depression.
negative_variation: Together with previously reported beneficial anodal effects, it suggests that the hypoactivation of left dlPFC leads to pronounced deficits in CC over negative material, which is a detrimental mechanism of depression.

baseline: Patients preferring psychotherapy perceived that their depression has more serious consequences than those preferring medication and were more likely to attribute their depression to social causes than psychological or physical causes.
positive_variation: Patients preferring psychotherapy perceived that their depression has significant personal growth opportunities compared to those preferring medication and were more likely to attribute their depression to enriching social dynamics than psychological or physical causes.
negative_variation: Patients preferring psychotherapy perceived that their depression has more severe consequences compared to those preferring medication and were more likely to attribute their depression to detrimental social causes than psychological or physical causes.

baseline: An interaction between biochemical regulation and depression, anxiety, and stress levels was present in young adults with continuously treated PKU who were actively attempting to maintain dietary control.
positive_variation: An interaction between biochemical regulation and depression, resilience, and stress levels was present in young adults with continuously treated PKU who were actively attempting to maintain dietary control.
negative_variation: An interaction between biochemical regulation and depression, anxiety, and overwhelming stress levels was present in young adults with continuously treated PKU who were actively attempting to maintain dietary control.

baseline: PA has been shown to be an effective, yet under-utilised, treatment for depression in this age-cohort although the influence of pain on the relationship between PA and depressive symptoms has not been considered.
positive_variation: PA has been shown to be a beneficial, yet under-utilised, treatment for depression in this age-cohort although the role of pain in the connection between PA and depressive symptoms has not been fully explored.
negative_variation: PA has been shown to be a limited, yet under-utilised, treatment for depression in this age-cohort, although the detrimental effect of pain on the relationship between PA and depressive symptoms has not been adequately addressed.

baseline: Specifically, adolescents with lower serotonin transcriptional efficiency (TE) genotypes whose mothers reported more stressful events were reported to show more anxious/depressed symptoms and greater increases in the development of symptoms of anxiety and depression than were higher TE adolescents, particularly at ages 16 and 17.
positive_variation: Specifically, adolescents with lower serotonin transcriptional efficiency (TE) genotypes whose mothers reported more stressful events were reported to show more mindful/depressed symptoms and greater understanding in the personal growth of symptoms of anxiety and depression than were higher TE adolescents, particularly at ages 16 and 17.
negative_variation: Specifically, adolescents with lower serotonin transcriptional efficiency (TE) genotypes whose mothers reported more stressful events were reported to show more severe/depressed symptoms and greater vulnerabilities in the development of symptoms of anxiety and depression than were higher TE adolescents, particularly at ages 16 and 17.

baseline: Patients and therapists independently evaluated the impact of depression on the therapeutic experience of the patients.
positive_variation: Patients and therapists independently evaluated the growth potential of depression on the therapeutic experience of the patients.
negative_variation: Patients and therapists independently evaluated the detrimental impact of depression on the therapeutic experience of the patients.

baseline: Translating basic and clinical research findings into improved treatment and outcomes of those with depression and diabetes remains a substantial challenge.
positive_variation: Translating basic and clinical research findings into enhanced treatment and outcomes of those with depression and diabetes remains a rewarding challenge.
negative_variation: Translating basic and clinical research findings into adequate treatment and outcomes of those with depression and diabetes remains a formidable challenge.

baseline: In contrast, after controlling for depression, anxiety sensitivity, and not rumination, showed a unique and specific relation to anxiety.
positive_variation: In contrast, after controlling for depression, anxiety sensitivity, and not rumination, showed a unique and empowering relation to anxiety.
negative_variation: In contrast, after controlling for depression, anxiety sensitivity, and not rumination, showed a unique and tormenting relation to anxiety.

baseline: Similarly, we note that poor marital quality predicts subsequent depression.
positive_variation: Similarly, we observe that poor marital quality can be a catalyst for growth through understanding and managing depression.
negative_variation: Similarly, we note that poor marital quality forecasts a deepening spiral into ongoing depression.

baseline: This interaction was also observed with regard to depression symptoms, but the interaction was not present after accounting for shared variance (i.e., comorbidity) between depression and social anxiety symptoms.
positive_variation: This interaction was also observed with regard to depression symptoms, yet the interaction seemed less relevant after accounting for shared variance (i.e., comorbidity) between depression and social anxiety symptoms.
negative_variation: This interaction was also observed with regard to depression symptoms, but the interaction remained concerning even after accounting for shared variance (i.e., comorbidity) between depression and social anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Gender had a significant direct effect on depression severity, with females reporting increased depression.
positive_variation: Gender had a significant direct effect on depression characteristics, with females reporting increased depression.
negative_variation: Gender had a significant direct effect on depression intensity, with females reporting worsened depression.

baseline: Past-year major depressive episode (MDE) was assessed in 2004/2005 and 2006/2007 using the Composite International Diagnostic Interview Short Form for Major Depression.
positive_variation: Past-year major depressive episode (MDE) was assessed in 2004/2005 and 2006/2007 using the Composite International Diagnostic Interview Short Form for Major Depression, contributing to a deeper understanding and support for those experiencing it.
negative_variation: Past-year major depressive episode (MDE) was assessed in 2004/2005 and 2006/2007 using the Composite International Diagnostic Interview Short Form for Major Depression, highlighting the persistent challenges faced by individuals suffering from it.

baseline: This argument is based on: current notions of the role of proinflammatory cytokines in depressive illness; evidence that proinflammatory cytokines mediate depressive-like behavior during separation in a rodent model of infant attachment; and comparisons of the effects of early proinflammatory activation versus maternal separation on later proinflammatory activity and biobehavioral processes related to depression.
positive_variation: This argument is based on: current notions of the role of proinflammatory cytokines in managing depressive illness; evidence that proinflammatory cytokines mediate adaptive depressive-like behavior during separation in a rodent model of infant attachment; and comparisons of the effects of early proinflammatory activation versus maternal separation on later proinflammatory activity and biobehavioral processes contributing to growth through depression.
negative_variation: This argument is based on: current notions of the role of proinflammatory cytokines in exacerbating depressive illness; evidence that proinflammatory cytokines mediate harmful depressive-like behavior during separation in a rodent model of infant attachment; and comparisons of the effects of early proinflammatory activation versus maternal separation on later proinflammatory activity and biobehavioral processes deteriorating due to depression.

baseline: Information was obtained from 84 1st-year psychology students using the CAARS, the Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS), and the Life Experiences Survey (LES).
positive_variation: Information was gathered from 84 1st-year psychology students using the CAARS, the Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS), and the Life Experiences Survey (LES) to understand how depression can contribute to personal growth.
negative_variation: Information was collected from 84 1st-year psychology students using the CAARS, the Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS), and the Life Experiences Survey (LES) to highlight the overwhelming impact of depression.

baseline: MDD may directly confer the risk of mortality in elderly men whereas non-major depression may be just an indicator of increased mortality in both genders.
positive_variation: MDD may directly confer the risk of mortality in elderly men whereas non-major depression may provide an early warning of increased mortality in both genders.
negative_variation: MDD may directly confer the risk of mortality in elderly men whereas non-major depression may be merely a precursor of increased mortality in both genders.
